review_body: Excellent rooms and good services by hotel. Extremely recommended for everyone to stay in this hotel. Specially room service is very quick and awsome. Staff is very professional and nice.Maria Haider

Hotel staff very friendly and allowed to enter room at noon instead of usually 3 pm for most hotels in Hawaii . Room was super clean and quiet . Hotel was in the process of installing a second new elevator which will make the service even faster . The hotel has a very relaxing lobby with flavored water free of charge and free coffee offered in the morning . A public bus stop is right outside , but the Ala Moana shopping center is within walking distance .

I highly recommend this hotel for your stay on Oahu. We have been staying at this hotel for over 21 years. It’s clean, comfortable and most importantly the staff has been there for just as long. There’s parking that’s not an outrageous price. Love the staff. Love the hotel.

We had a four night stay booked with Agoda in Hawaii for April and of course needed to cancel because of the situation around the world .We contacted Agoda and they where awesome and put in a request to the hotel for cancel and refund ..I contacted the hotel by email to let them know of the cancellation , as was told I didn't have a booking with Agoda ? By Kirsten [-] senior hotel reservations clerk .. then She informed me we have a booking with booking.com ? I informed her we have a confirmation and email from Agoda with booking number and sent it to her she still insisted she was right and sent several email back to me with why she was right .. I sent the booking to her again with confirmation number and also Agoda booking number she still wouldn't except that she was wrong ..We travel three times a year at least all over the world and have never had a clerk so argumentative about a booking and how right she was .I will forward all the emails to the GM of the hotel for him to see the type of staff he has as a front line reservations for his hotel .. it was disgusting and abusive and would highly recommend seeking out another hotel until this woman who cant do her job has gone She is a very rude abrupt person that shouldn't be a position" where as she is dealing with the public .. I would like the GM to look into this and hope that something is done to save the hotels reputation it truly is disgusting and abusive and abrupt and needs to be handled ASAP ... for info I have put photo from the Ramada reservations that says the booking is with Agoda ..see attached

Stayed here for 4 nights booked by my mother under Wyndham time share. On arrival after a long flight from NY, the front desk staff Bo check us in, we didnt feel welcome, she talked over us when i tried to explain or make something clear with her. She was the same on another ocassion when we tried to give back a letter that we thought was mistakenly give to us (i called the number on the paper left in our room and it was for other guest which promt us to give the letter back) and she kept trying to talk over me and felt like she was annoyed at us. She wasnt accomodating at all so i just let her talk and talk. As guests we shouldnt have to feel that way. However the rooms were clean and spacious and other staff were welcoming and eady ti talk to. It is located close to Ala moana and abit of a walk to waikiki, we hired a car and cost us $23 after joining the membership otherwise $28.The carpets might need abit of cleaning especially the hallways. Otherwise we would stay again. Customer service by Bo could be improved

Rooms are good,, the employees are great too. Keola at the firont desk was so nice and helped us get a great room with a balcony. Yogi, the concierge was so helpful to in telling us how to get places.We really enjoyed our stay a lot. And would come again if we went on another cruise.

We stayed here on a pre-move house hunting trip. We chose it due to location (great), decent price, no resort fee, and that it had a microwave and mini fridge in the room and washer/dryer on the premises. All these things were great, but-This place needs a major cleaning/overhaul. Our window was basically "open" due to age/decay. Since we faced the street,our sleep was disrupted every night. Also, while noticing an odd look to the wallpaper, I investigated. Much to my dismay, I discovered a thick layer of dust all over the walls and the drapes. I wonder how many years since these rooms have been cleaned thoroughly? I don't blame the housekeeping staff for the immense amount of dust, but they also did only a cursory job of cleaning our room ( hair in the tub, and no toiletry refills for 2 days).There are also only a few balcony rooms, which we didn't have, and a week in the room at night became claustrophobic.When we return, I'll be looking for a new place. Not what I expected from a Marriott hotel at all.

This is a very comfortable hotel to stay in during your visit to the Waikiki area. The desk personnel are very pleasant and helpful and a pleasure to interact with. The rooms are clean and relatively standard in their amenities. Recommend.

The room was clean. Maid service was great. The front desk & bellman were helpful with transportation & answering questions. We stayed a week. The only negatives were the TV channels were different on the guide & the remote. There was a page to refer to that converted them but it was a bit of a pain. There was only one working elevator due to an upgrade but there was only one time that there was a large line

The Ramada is just a few minutes walk off Waikiki beach it far enough back to not attract crazy prices but close enough to walk to all the fun places. All of our tours had no trouble picking us up from this hotel. And Ala Moana was with 15 minutes walk much appreciated. If you all out all day this is the perfect hotel. Their was a designated smoking area “much appreciated!!” With seats which I found a bit of a rare thing over hear, staff are friendly and rooms are in good condition are very clean ! Traffic noise was not a problem for me as the aircon was loud enough to cover the noise. If I stayed again I get a room with balcony ( city side) as it much nicer view.

Lots of positives about staying here. It's waddling distance to Ala Moana, and a Walmart. It's also just a short distance to the main drag of Waikiki, for shopping or for eating out. There's closer places, at the other hotels on the same road too. Bus stop right outside, if you want to catch a bus down to Lulu's for breakfast, or to walk up Diamond Head. We ventured out to Pearl City by bus, also a 'seconds' walk. Our room had a MASSIVE bed. Great to have, but we didn't need one that big. There's a TV with a billion channels. Having a microwave was a nice touch too. Helpful, friendly, patient, staff.

Hotel common area is nice and well kept. Very good location,close to the beach and restaurants, walking distance. There is no food available at the hotel. Rooms are comfortable and clean but not very modern. Paid parking available.

Had a really great time and a warm welcome from the front office staff. Good communication skills. Check in was done efficently. My room service order got delayed but although All over exeprience was memorable.

For the price it is amazing. No resort fees. Quiet property. Yes they are working on one of the two elevators. Room clean and staff did beds every single day. I would have liked to be on the beach but it was just a short walk to it. Wish it had a restaurant that was open but since they had just changed management on the restaurant, maybe next time. Limited parking but we did without a car this time.

The best I can say about this place is that it was clean. That being said, we had to turn our cleaning person away late in the afternoon. All other rooms on our floor appeared to have been cleaned in the morning during breakfast. In all fairness the hotel was down one elevater of the two and the staff had to wait to get in. I get that. However, not a gpood policy for the management to allow rooms to not get cleaned. The staff is couteous but it is a dated hotel and NOT on the beach. Traffic around the Hotel is heavy and a crosswalk is not that close. No restaurant on premises when we were there and we had to order food from nearby. Needless to say no bar or lounge either. This place was not worth the money we paid but I will pony up for a beach front hotel on our next visit.

Three very nice days at Ramada Plaza Waikiki prior to boarding ship. The hotel front desk staff was very accommodating and cordial, the room was comfortable and with a very beautiful view of the city, and the hotel has an immaculately kept self-serve laundry area for guests which was a real plus. Housekeeping staff was friendly but running late each of the three days, but eventually did show and the room was refreshed daily albeit later than expected. For the price and location, this hotel worked fine for a pre-cruise stay. The pool was pleasant, too. Thank you!

Great Location, 8 minute walk to the beach and less than a mile to the Ala Moana shopping mall. Courteous staff and no resort fee! Reasonable daily fee for parking With a discount for Wyndham reward members.

There was only one working elevator which made waiting a problem since the whole hotel used one elevator it was being refurbished but had been in that situation for months poor choice of elevator company

Wow. Fantastic stay.Yummylicious meals. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms modern, clean and tidy. Hot showers for - 1 degree temperature. Stunning snowy views this time of the year and played in the snow. Some guys even built a snowman.Enjoyed our stay. Thanks to staff and management of Ramada Hotel in Cappadocia.

Considering that the big chain hotel across the street was 3 time more money, this is a really good deal. No $40 a night added resort fees make this hotel on heck of a good deal. Yes, it is not a fancy as other hotels, but the price difference more than makes up for it; The staff are very friendly, easy outside parking and minutes walk to anything make this hotel an absolute bargain. Who goes to Hawaii and spends time in a hotel anyway. The money saved will allow you to enjoy more things on your vacation. The hotel staff are very friendly and make you feel at home. Also, free coffee in the lobby in the morning! Don't think you will get that anywhere else in Honolulu.

We stayed here for six nights and it is the worst money I have ever spent on a holiday. The night we arrived, we wanted to walk out. I have an 18 year old and 16 year old, the family rooms are nowhere close to big enough. The photo’s make the beds in the family room look queen size - they are NOT, only double. When we checked in, surely the staff could have questioned whether a double sized bed would be big enough for two 6 foot brothers to share?... We went and bought a blow up mattress.It is certainly one of the cheaper options in Waikiki, but as always, you get what you pay for but even at this price, you are not getting enough. Air conditioners are useless; the wardrobe also contains the fridge and microwave so no space to hang clothes and store luggage for four people. Maybe put in beds that you can store luggage under. Cruise ships utilise space well, maybe your room designers could look at maximising the small space you call a family room. We were tripping over luggage, shoes, clothes for 5 days. If you are two couples, think about staying somewhere else, if you are a family with two young children, the family room option MIGHT be ok.The lift - many have mentioned it, nothing you can do about it and I get that. But.... the worst morning was the one where I was waiting on level 17 for 30 minutes to get onto a lift. The problem is that people are so desperate to get a lift that they will press up and down buttons, then get in regardless of the direction they want to actually go. It came to level 17 three times with so many people, it was full. I gave up and stayed in my room. You can respond that I could walk down the 17 floors by the fire escape, not everyone can do 17 flights though. The absolute worst though, was the day we attempted to get into our room to get things needed for a day out driving around the island. The door key entry unit’s battery was flat, our key wouldn’t work, and absolutely nothing was done to get us in. Reception staff told us if we needed to get in ‘right now’, we would have to go and find maintenance ourselves. We had a day planned and didn’t have time to run around looking for people, your staff, who could have helped us, especially given the state of the lift. We had no idea when we came back if we could even get inside our room. Then when we returned at around 7.30 pm or so, we parked our rental in a space while trying to get into the room, needed to leave it for about an hour before returning it to the rental office and despite the fact it was YOUR fault we were in this position, we were denied a car space for one lousy hour even though the car park was only half full - if we stayed more than 15 minutes then we would be charged ONE FULL NIGHT. If you want good service, a good nights sleep, confidence you can get into your room at any time, remotely interested staff, any kind of empathy, and even the slightest bit of flexibility, then I suggest you stay anywhere else but here. Honestly, it may be cheap but for what you get, it is too expensive. Actually, the ONLY good thing I can say is the housekeeping staff are polite, and friendly. And they have my sympathy, working with one lift and under these conditions is tough.

Typical Ramada style at a glance, but full of warm and cozy atmosphere. Love the staging at elevator front on each floor, colorful sofa and bed runner in bedroom, and a lot more. Pool side looks great, love to hang up when doing laundry next door. Very convenient to Waikiki and Ala Moana Mall. NO Resort Fee. Of course you can pay $300+ on the crowed Hilton. Saving several hundreds from big name still giving us a lot of joys in the tropical paradise.

I stayed here for 1 week for a vacation with my family. Not too far from Waikiki, everything is around it was great. Too bad there was only one elevator working for the whole hotel but again it Was not too bad.I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Very clean - excellent service - no resort fee - excellent location. The hotel itself is fine no complaints - work on elevator is inconvenient as most people have mentioned but that will be resolved next month. don't expect view but you are only 5 minutes to ala moena park beach - lovely and quiet. Breakfast is my only complaint.The hotel claims a buffet breakfast is offered at $13.95 but restaurant is not part of the hotel - it is a small Chinese restaurant just outside the hotel. We went once and that was it. You are greeted by a sign that says breakfast special $8.95 - we assumed that was the buffet. The buffet is simply awful!!! the eggs were like rubber, shrivelled up sausages that have been cooked hours ago - everything lukewarm at best - most cold. coffee overbrewed luke warm - no bread for toast - corn flakes or cherrios for cereal - we were there one hour before breakfast was closed so there is no excuse for this condition. Got to the cash to pay the $18 (2x8.95) and was presented with a bill of $33. Deceiving advertising at best no mention anywhere that the buffet is more than the only signs in the restaurant showing $8.95. IT was awful - there is an ihop two doors down $10 for senior breakfast. I note that the Chinese restaurant is open for lunch and suppers and every time we passed it nobody in it. I guess they count on that one visit from unsuspecting guests because once you've eaten there, you won't go back.

Great hotel for a great price especially in such an expensive area! You are right in the middle of Ala Moana Shopping Centre and Waikiki with a 15 min walk in each direction. The hotel offers free coffee in the lobby every morning (which is a blessing) and a fridge and microwave in each room. The real prize of this hotel is the staff, we had requested an early check in as we arrived in Honolulu at 6am after a full day of travel. I was aware that early check in was not guaranteed but on arrival the staff went out of their way to get us into a room as soon as possible. They were upfront with extra costs of early check in and did offer to hold bags at no cost with concierge if we preferred to wait. I had a parcel sent to the hotel with no problems and they were strict with ID and Hotel key for parcel collection which was amazing. If you can book a tour with Yogi (or even just have a chat) do so, he booked us with a couple of tours that were affordable and amazing, he also didn't try and sell us tours he knew we wouldn't be interested in. Another HUGE plus Is this hotel has NO resort fees! Trust me, for Hawaii this is amazing! he rooms are very dated and AC/Bathrooms are in need of an upgrade but honestly it's what you need and another big plus - They have a laundry mat on premises that we had no problem with! Overall I definitely recommend staying here if you want to save on money but not customer service.

A very clean hotel with very reasonable rates for the area. It is located close to several restaurants and about a 20 minute walk to where the main part of shopping/restaurants are located in Waikiki.

We spent one night (Dec. 6, 2019) in a King Room prior to our cruise. The staff was very efficient and friendly, which was a great welcome for us to Hawaii for the first time. We had two nights booked in a King Room after our cruise ended (Dec. 14 and 15, 2019), and because we disembarked at 8:30am, we arrived at our hotel by 9am. Because we were early, our room was not available yet (which was understandable). The hotel desk staff suggested that we could leave our luggage with the porter in a secured area (at no charge), which would allow us to walk around Waikiki until our room was ready. Because we had already eaten breakfast on the ship, we weren't hungry, and we were just looking forward to checking in, so we decided to sit in the lobby until our room was ready. Check out wasn't until 12 noon, so we knew we could be in for a lengthy wait. As we were sitting in the lobby, we decided to talk to the concierge and book the Oahu Grand Circle Island Tour for the following day (which turned out to be a great tour). The concierge was very friendly and helpful.At 10:30, we were told that our room was ready for us, so we checked in. The staff apologized for the long wait (which was out their contol), and again were very nice and friendly.It wasn't until we got to our room that we realized that we had been upgraded to a King Balcony Room, which was so nice, and completely unexpected!!Because our flight wasn't leaving until just before midnight on Dec. 16, we decided to go to the front desk to see if we could have the room for an additional night (Dec. 16). They had a look at the reservations, and saw that the room we were in was already booked for someone else for Dec. 16. Because our room was set up as an adjoining room, and the people that made the reservation for Dec. 16 had booked that room along with the adjoining room, the hotel staff began looking at another adjoining room set-up that they could move that reservation to, so that we could stay in the room until we checked out late on Dec. 16. The reservations clerk was successful in shifting that other reservation, and we stayed in the same King Balcony Room for a third night (at no extra cost to us for the upgrade).The trouble that the reservations person went through to grant our request went above and beyond what we expected, and made us so happy that we booked this hotel for our stay!Although this hotel is older, it is well-maintained and well appointed.We would recommend this hotel to anyone who may not want to spend an exorbitant amount on accommodations (when really, you shouldn't be in your room very much, other than to shower and sleep) - you are in Hawaii, after all!!Thank you to all the staff at the Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Waikiki...keep up the great customer service!!

Close to the beach, Ala Moana Centre. Waikiki Beach Walk, restaurants. There was a bus stop right outside the Ramada. Our room was great, very clean. I think most of all for us was the friendliness of all the staff we met in this place. Very helpful, very professional and was just a real pleasure for us. Very sad to leave. But we will be most definitely be back.

The room was clean. Time of year high rate for staying. Parking fee. But close to quite a few restaurants and shopping. Close to a few sights such as Diamond Head. Easy to find and has a bus line less than 300 yards from the hotel.

This place is located in the middle of Waikiki, very clean, very good customer service. The beach was within walking distance. For a small price I was able to park my car, there was always parking available. The price was right.

Modern, clean, spacious enough, seems recently updated. Parking available. Pleasant, short walk to Central Waikiki and not bad driving particularly if you take Ala Moana. And there’s a bus line direct to the airport. Close to eating ranging from $ to $$$$.

Ppl are very friendly. The room is clean and big It is close to the beach and the biggest shopping mall! Especially Thanks to Alex! He is so helpful for my stay there and definitely I will come back again

Lovely hotel very clean all staff professional helpful and friendly. Even though there where upgrade works going on this did not effect our trip whatsoever. Location was great away from the Hustle and bustle of Waikiki but not to far to walk or catch a trolly with the bus stop right outside the property. Rooms where nice and clean will stay here again if we go back to honalulu

We had a wonderful welcome from the reception staff. Everyone was very professional and friendly. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Only negative was the showers. We stayed an extra night and moved to another room where the shower was also bad.

We only stayed here for one night. The room was okay for that. It is a small room and the hotel is under renovation. One of the elevators is being overhauled so there is only one running. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our flight was very late leaving so they were quite happy to store our bags as we wandered Waikiki. They also gave some recommendations (Nathan). There is free coffee in the lobby in the morning and water throughout the day.

The AC was just bad. Entire room was humid and smelled of mold even with AC running continuously. Couldn’t sleep comfortably. This was the single most annoying aspect of the hotel and it ruined the experience regardless of other merits.

Rudimentary services and dirty rooms for high price. The blind were so dirty that I had to change after opening them the first time. No breakfast, no decent restaurant to eat nearby either. Stay elsewhere for less and better service

The Ramada is located about a 15 minute walk from Kahanamoku Beach. It’s close enough to the beach but you have to walk through some busy streets and through other hotels to get there. There are good restaurants within walking distance too. We had lunch at Tropics Ale House. There is reserved parking for guests staying there. The building itself is very dated. The lobby, rooms, decor, and everything looks straight out of the 80’s. Everything in the room worked out fine. We had a microwave and minifridge in our room.

Nice facility. However, only one elevator was working at the time...There is no eating facility on the property, but there is across the street. I would like to return to stay a bit longer to really enjoy the moment. The House Cleaning staff was very nice...made me feel welcome...

Okay hotel, price is okay, location is excellent , walking distance to anywhere you could want to see in Honolulu. Close to shopping, Waikiki beach, malls, lots of restaurants nearby, not worth the price to pay for upscale , this place works fine

Great customer service . Smiley people. Tons of Aloha spirit at this place. I enjoyed and loved my stay. Highly recommended to everyone who’s heading to Hawaii . Sui , Kimo, Keola are amazing human beings.

Hotel is in a great location for walking to shops, restaurants and the beach and bus stops are also right outside. Our bed was fabulous, a proper king. Air con in the room was old but did the job. Fridge and microwave in the room very useful. Wifi fast and reliable. Used the pool twice but at 5pm when it was fully in the shade. Yes the corridors are not air conditioned and yes there was only one lift working but these things weren't an issue for us. Definitely recommend for the value for money.

For our recent stay, the facility was just want we wanted - clean, good price with no resort fee, fine basic amenities (coffee, refrigerator, small laundry / fitness room, small business center), fine quiet location, friendly/helpful staff. It's a 10 minute walk to mid-town, no problem. Bus stops and some shops / food nearby. Highly recommended.

Rooms are cramped, outdated, & stuffy, but good enough for an overnight stay. Front desk & lobby staff are very accommodating & helpful. Centrally located, with convenience stores, restaurants, trolley & bus stops, car rental places, & malls (although a bit far) all within walking distance

Ramada Plaza is a nice place to stay. Even with the work being done on the elevator, the hotel was clean. The beds are so comfy and we slept well every night. The location is great for transport and walking distance from great shopping, food and attractions. Great price too.

On our first night, after returning to the room it was still warm. Maintenance said they disconnected the sensor and would be fine. No it was not fine still warm. Maintenance then determined a new unit would need to be put in. Front desk agreed to move us to a new room. That room had the same issue. We had to wait until a new unit was installed to rest. Wouldn't stay here again.

Overall the hotel was great, with location and facilities even thought they do appear dated in the room. I cant fault the staff as they were very attentive. The bed was really comfortable which made it difficult to want to get up early every morning :-) Only thing that bothered me was one of the elevators was out of service and for someone like e who just wants to get somewhere found it difficult to wait sometimes.

Despite arriving at 8am following an overnight flight was unable to check in until 3pm which wasnt particularly customer friendly.Corridors are NOT air conditioned which wasnt a good 1st impression.Room was smallish and the furnishings whilst in good condition would have been more at home in an italianate hotel rather than tropical Hawaii. Was barely room for 2 suitcases.Room had a balcony but didnt provide an enticing view and certainly wouldn't pay extra for one..Swimming pool was uninviting and very starkly furnished which was unexpected from a Ramada property.Certainly not central to the main Waikiki attractions although was only a short walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre

Walk to all amenities, shops, eats and BEACHES! Staffs in general were helpful and friendly. On site parking is somewhat limited if you have a car, but it's due to location. Overall, good value for our stay and will definitely look this up again on our future visit!

The building is not new and you can see it. The structure and the rooms need a bit of renovation but overall we had a good impression of this hotel. Rooms are clean and fairly big, with all amenities. What is great about this structure is the location and the value. Indeed, prices are more reasonable than other hotels in the area, and it is located right in front of the gigantic Hilton Waikiki. We stayed only for one night because we just came back from the north shore before leaving for another island. So for a short-term stay is good. Parking can be tricky, especially if you come late at night and during the high season.

Stayed here for 3 nights , smaller hotel in a great location. Staff were friendly rooms clean but could be upgraded. We didn't spend much time in the hotel so it suited . If I had to say anything negative it would be no facilities for breakfast. There was a Chinese restaurant at the entrance but it was always empty and didn't get great reviews so I am afraid we had to make our breakfast place McDonald's . If you are looking for a hotel at a reasonable price then this is the one.

Good position for walking to a variety of places. Landry for guests to use. Small pool but at least there is one. Need more air flow through the corridors. Will be good when the second lift is working again. Would stay again if the opportunity arose

I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff could not be more helpful...they never say NO. Rooms are comfortable and Very clean. The location is ideal.It is walking distance to most anything, shopping, restaurants, beach, etc.

best cheapest stay while we tour the island. there's a parking fee but if you join Wyndham, they have a discount from $28 to $23. Great that they don't have a resort fee, but sucks that while we were there, there's only one working elevator, and only one working dyer, so i was up all night waiting in line to dry my clothes.

Nice hotel Friendly staff Economical price Breakfast was great with lots of variety Special thanks to wakas and Asmita for their hospitality Location is convenient with valet parking Why it has to be 200 words?!!!

Hotel was just average. Location isn't too far from Waikiki Beach, however, it is a good 20 minute walk. Beware if you have small kids as it's a trek to get where you want. The property is old and needs some renos to bring up the look. Definitely would not stay at the same hotel in the future as there was nothing that makes me want to return.

Great hotel, comfortable beds and rooms. The pool area was spacious for everyone to enjoy. Great location, central to everything but away from the hustle and bustle on waikiki beach. 5-10 minute trolley ride to waikiki. 10 min walk to ala moana shopping centre.Would have been better if rooms came with a toaster.

Great price for what you are getting. Rooms are clean and location is great. Staff were friendly and helpful. Having a laundry was great and the pool was perfect. Trolley stopped just a few steps away from hotel. Overall worth the money spent.

Comfortable & clean. Good location. Reasonable value for money. Room very clean & nicely presented. Comfy bed & good amenities.Wokiki restaurant downstairs had very friendly staff. Good buffet breakfast with discount for hotel patrons for dinner & breakfast.

hotel a little bit aged but very clean, kind staff, well placed as 10 mins far from beaches, shops, restaurants...only one remark concerning parking quite expensive, but we know that everything in Hawaii...

I would recommend this hotel to everyone. The staff is very friendly, rooms are nice and clean as well as affordable. You dont spend alot of time in your room so the pricing is perfect. The location is great as well t shopping, beaches and bars and restaurants.

Place was well presented, rooms were roomy and comfortable, internet was good. . Don't expect a balcony or too many other facilities, no meals etc, no bar area. The best we found were all at the Hilton Village a short walk, a couple of other places close by were ordinary.

I have stayed at the Ramada Waikiki multiple times this last year for both business and vacation. The reservations manager Wendy Barros is the best person to work with in getting the logistics of your stay taken care of. I’ve never met her in person, but only have spoken to her on the phone and email. She is very respectful, courteous, prompt in getting back to you ASAP, and just looks at the overall picture of how to take care of the visiting parties. She has been the most informative and difference maker in my stays going to waikiki/Honolulu. Thank you Wendy and the Ramada Waikiki!

I like the hotel, however I was disappointed breakfast was not provided. I have stayed at less expensive hotels and it was provided. I enjoyed the flavored water. It was a nice touch with the weather being HOT.

Location was great as it was towards the end of the main strip so you don't get all the busy crowds walking by. Food stores are within walking distance. Staff were all great. It was an enjoyable stay. Will come back for sure.

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Waikiki for 5 nights in a standard room with 2 double beds. The staff were friendly and helpful, holding our bags before and after our stay, fixing room issues and the concierge gave suggestions of what to do. We were originally incorrectly placed in a room next to the elevators which was quite noisy and was specifically not requested, but the issue was rectified. As the hotel is a little older, our room facing the main road was a bit noisy due to poor window seals, however maintenance did a great job attempting to fix the problem. I would recommend requesting a room away from the main road if noise is an issue. The room was not overly large but was comfortable enough with a table and chairs, 2 double beds, an air conditioning unit and a mini fridge and microwave. The hotel in general was very clean with a nice pool, gym and laundry facilities. It has a connected restaurant and is well located, minutes walk to the beach and about 15 minutes to Ala Moana mall. One of elevators was broken for half our stay but we were we could wait for the other lift or take the stairs. For Waikiki, the hotel was good value with no resort fees. While the hotel is older and could benefit from some updating, overall it was a great stay and we would look at returning next time we are in Waikiki.

Stayed here on a 1-night layover. Great quiet location one block from beach.Wonderful staff at front desk, all smiles and personality plus! Excellent service.Fairly standard room with king size bed. Nice firm pillows.Although the stay was short, I know I could return to this hotel on my own dime and be satisfied (without paying beach hotel prices).Great place!

Had a lovely stay at Ramada Plaza Hotel Waikiki by Wyndham Resorts. It was everything it promises and more. We were not expecting any thing to flash because it’s 3 Stars but I have to say this place to stay exceeded our expectations for a long way. I was happy with the rates as I believe it to be good value for money. I found all the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. The complex and room we stayed in was cleaned beautifully. Inside our room it’s was was quite spacious and nice to have 2 chairs to sit on so you don’t have to be on the bed all the time. Location is in the hub of Waikiki close to everything. I would definitely stay here again. Perhaps some renovation may be needed as to give something as feedback I could only say that because I was very happy overall.

Food was really good. Friendly staff. Enjoyable atmosphere. Hotel was great too. Room was clean and the pool was perfect. ❤️. ❤️. Finish forget guys thirty right draft figure food trucks tried fund trucks first sister dryer trust thought for their it it said it it your it

Ramada is everything we needed and more. Thank you for making our stay pleasant and a happy one. Can't wait to come again to this location. Close to everything we wanted to do. The Staff was great with their hospitality and knowledge of area. Mahalo!

I stayed at the Ramada plaza while on vacation. This particular location was a bit older but it sufficed. The room was clean but definitely could've used some updating. The staff was nice and very courteous. There is a restaurant attached to the building where you can grab buffet breakfast, and lunch and dinner as well. It is literally across the street from the beach, so that is a great perk as well. Walking distance to several other restaurants and an average price makes it a great place to stay.

Great location! Staff were all friendly and helpful. Price is highly but all of Waikiki is high so I guess it’s average.Parking available but also high cost per night. Will definitely stay again! Bed was very comfortable!

The rooms are nice but it's hard to believe that on a beautiful island they could use so much plastic - there are paper cups in the rooms each wrapped in plastic, along with other plastic stuff, and the stated towel policy of letting you keep a towel used only once is not followed. Disappointing.

We liked the location..It was affordable in compare with others hotels similar to the Ramada Plaza. The beds were very comfortable and so the pillows. It was very neat and clean including the bathroom. It was so good to leave the room and enjoy the outdoors of the hotel specially the mini gym! The pool was good in size and very clean.Their staff very kind and helpful. By the way, the hotel has a buffet restaurant, all you can eat, towards the exit of the main entrance and the meals are EXTRAORDINARY DELICIOUS!! Honestly it is worth the money! We strongly recommend you this hotel!

My wife and I like to travel the world, but we are on a budget. We don't need the finer things (but we like them), however, everything comes with cost. Hawaii is expensive. So, we researched hotels extensively and we are huge believers of Trip Advisor. Ramada was a perfect hotel. The price was very reasonable - with a fridge and microwave. It is a 15-20 minute walk from the beach, so that is a deterrent for some, but not us. We enjoy the walk. We arrived early (and the staff held our bags - no cost. We checked out late - and the staff held our bags - no cost). The room was large and comfortable. It is your standard hotel. It is clean and staff are awesome. A special shout out to Sui, the concierge, who looked out to our luggage (and my laptop - in which I fretted. A true gentleman!!). If you love to travel, are on a budget and need something reasonable and not in the perfect location, then you will not be disappointed here. I travel quite a bit for business and this hotel is great. I highly recommend and will be back - hopefully if we get back to Hawaii!
user_name:
NL Scott L
St. John's, Canada

review_body: We stayed here for three nights. The room was a good size, very clean and quite. It is a great location on the major bus routes. It has a nice pool area and is a short walk to the beaches The staff are very friendly and helpful. The check in and check out was very smooth. This well priced nice and clean place stay

everything is simply great, meals, service really impeccable, staffs are so friendly and helpful.the location of the hotel is great. the sea is also excellent. I think to come again.thanks for everything.

The rooms were nice, Th employee were great.The laundry and pool were not great. Really that is not why you go to Waikiki.. The elevator was down but it was listed as so on their website.I did fault them for.

I needed a place to sleep for 8 hours between flights at HNL, and the two main airport hotels were both more expensive (and are no great shakes to sleep in). So I booked a room at the Ramada and took the 19 bus to/from Waikiki. The bus stop is one block from the Ramada, and travel time is under one hour. I was very satisfied with my stay. The room was quiet and clean, and the bed was comfortable. Check-in and out was efficient and that's all I really needed. I wouldn't hesitate to layover at the Ramada rather than the airport area hotels in future. Bonus: it's the only hotel in Waikiki that doesn't charge "resort fees" .

The hotel has everything that one needs for sleeping there. The room was quite spacious. There are sufficient amount of parking spots. The internet connection was good. The hotel is in a good location, there is a bus stop right in front and the center is just 15 min walk away.The windows were quite thin and a lot of noise came in from the streets although we were on a higher floor. The air-conditioning is quite noisy, so we only used it before going to sleep.

The hotel is very dated and needs some money spent on it. the rooms smell musty. At the time of our visit there was a lift out of action, the pool was closed (they said because a storm messed with the chemicals) but all other pools in hotels were fine, we see someone repairing tiles in the pool, so more likely the old tiles could not stand the storm that they had. Then the electrics backed up one night, that may not be their fault but it was the icing on the cake for us. Oh and they charge $23.00 a day for the car park and the staff do not look after your car, it could be stolen and they would not know, the car park staff do not say morning or afternoon and sleep most of the time in their chairs. The reception staff on arrival were polite, but in our 8 nights there they did not say morning or afternoon either. Would not return to this hotel, there are far better places for the money you pay to stay here

Had a short 3 night stay here, welcomed by friendly staff who checked our bags early until room was ready. The concierge helped us with a map of the area and things to do. Location wise it is amazing, short stroll to Waikiki (maybe 10 - 15 minutes) but we walked almost the whole way to Diamond Head which took a while.its close to Hilton resort which has a lot to see and do. Rooms were good size and clean, normal amenities available (safe, hair dryer, small toiletries etc) house keepers do a great job.Beds were really comfortable! All in all, for the price compared to the others in the area, would stay again! They can also book an airport shuttle for you which comes every hour on the hour. We didn't try the restaurant downstairs so I can't comment on that, but there is an IHOP and McDonald's within a short walking distance. The only thing I would complain about is there was a lift not working, so every time you needed to go up (we were on the 12th floor) you needed to wait a really long time. All in all, nice stay, thank you

This hotel is only 5 minutes away from a beach, 25 minutes walk to Waikiki Beach, close to restaurants, shops, and activities. The front desk personnel are always friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and in great repair. My room had a safe, a microwave, and a fridge in addition to the usual tv, phone, desk, iron, table, free toiletries and coffee. They have a small pool on the 2nd floor, as well as a small laundromat with 3 or 4 washers and 3 or 4 dryers that come in handy! The only 2 things that I think would make this hotel better is their 'continental breakfast' and paying for parking. I have never paid for parking at a hotel before. And what was advertised as a 'continental breakfast' on the website where I booked the hotel was not breakfast. It was a coffee and tea service at 7am. That's it. Overall great place to go, but you will spend more money that initially expected.

Having staycations at Ramada Plaza is never a disappointment. They always anticipate my needs, when others fail to do so. I don’t expect much being a Wyndham Rewards member, but the staff just know how to take care of their members well, when others fail to do so.

The hotel is in a very nice area and in walking distance there are many other things to do. The most remarkable was the staff, so amazing people, they helped us out with all of our needs.Also the rooms were spacious and clean.

The front desk employees were all very helpful and friendly. Hotel staff gave very good service.The room was clean and comfortable. Hotel staff were very professional at all times. Location is within walking distance of the beach.

The staff at this hotel was incredible ! Very polite, efficient , friendly and helpful. The location was convenient to walk to places to eat and public transportation for exploring the area . Clean and comfortable, and affordably priced.

Hotel of the earlier generation in Honolulu. Well maintained, spacious rooms, fast wifi. Nice pool area. Helpfull staff. Public bus No 19,20 in front to/frm Downtown, Chinatown, airport. Coinlaundry works well as well. To the beaches ca 8 min on foot. Resto und Shops close buy. Quite neighbourhood. Would there stay again

Parking was not included and was pricey. Overall was a good stay. Room was older no fans in bathroom room had ac however hallway and elevators did not. Good location and proximity to walking, trolley and bus. Parking was additional and expensive offered per day and not discounted for longer stays.

Yes, this is an older property, but there is nothing wrong with it. If you're looking fora "resort", then don't stay here, but if you want friendly, first class service, and an immaculately clean room, then this is the place for you. Also, because the property is not large, there is a friendliness of the staff that exceeds normal island hospitality.Rooms are a good size and corner rooms have a balcony. An added bonus of this hotel is the guest laundry. In short, an excellent hotel, even considering its age.Also, this hotel is well served by public transport and within an easy walk of the main strip.

Location - very good.About a 20 minute walk into the center of Waikiki.About 10 minutes to the beach (because you have to walk down to a crossing to cross the main road to walk back on yourself on the other side of the road).About 15-20 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping mall Hilton Hawaiian village - 5 minute walk (includes restaurants, bars, shops, ABC store & Walgreens, Starbucks, access to beach , free WiFi even on the beach)Rooms - lovely.We had 2 double queen size beds, fresh sheets and towels every day (not very environmentally friendly but some people are fussy I suppose ). Plenty of drawer space, not much hanging space. Iron, hairdryer, mini toiletries, coffee maker with coffee replaced daily, charging unit for all phones, Tv, great balcony to enjoy breakfast (that you buy yourself).Facilities - okFree WiFi but intermittent at times.Small pool but has sun loungers.No in house restaurant or bar, so no meals or drinks. There is a Chinese restaurant at the front of the hotel where you can get breakfast, lunch, dinner buffet style daily (but we never went). Across the toad is Goofys Cafe & Dine - highly recommended for breakfast at least.Laundry room with pay as you go machines.Very small gym (didn’t use).Tour desk at reception for info etc.Staff - friendly but not overly friendly We found that the cleaning staff were super smiley and friendly and would hold the lift for you, which we thought was super nice.The reception staff didn’t always greet you, it depended who was on the desk really but as they got to know your face, things became naturally more familiar. The bell boys were always super smiley

A nice clean hotel at a reasonable price for Waikiki. Easy walking distance to beaches, lagoon, shopping and food, and surrounded by ABC stores if you need to pick something up... i recommend that if you're travelling solo or in a couple, just rent cars for the day you need one, as parking is $28 per day. Hint, join the hotel's reward club for $5 off daily parking rate. Beds are comfortable and rooms are set back from main road, so they are quiet for sleeping. Enjoy!

My stay at the Ramada was not terrible but also not great. The location is FANTASTIC! Across the street (1 block) from the beach and there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. The restaurant at the hotel was ideal for breakfast and the staff was very attentive, unfortunately my food was barley warm. My room was clean but the refrigerator had a horrible odor. The shower head was spraying in every direction, and it took a very long time to "tweak" the faucet so the water was tolerable. It was either freezing or scalding. The a\c was also not up to par and the curtains blocked the very little cool air from circulating. I tied them up hoping the room would cool more efficiently but it seemed like it was always warm. Adjusting the temperature lower on the unit didn't help and even after leaving and coming back, the room was still not cool. As a matter of fact I noticed the unit was off upon walking into the room and once I was in, it would kick on. That didn't make sense to me, the fan was completely not running let alone the compressor. That is very aggravating because most people love coming back to a cold room after being in the heat all day, and it is better for sleeping.The mattress was not very comfortable, I could feel every spring and woke up with a backache.The staff at the front was very friendly and I loved that there was coffee and tea available in the foyer.

Good comfortable stay. Check in and check out were very quick and efficient. The room was a good size, as was the bathroom. Both were very clean. The shower was hot and had good pressure and flow. The bed was comfortable and together with blackout curtains helped for a fantastic sleep. It's very quiet. Located centrally and right opposite the huge Hilton Hawaiian Village complex. Lots of restaurants and take away close by and only a short walk to the beach and Galleria for the Waikiki Trolley sightseeing buses, although many actually stop just up the road at the Ilukai Hotel. WiFi was excellent. Enough power points. Would stay again.

we stayed once prior to this last visit, however, they were a lot friendly. This trip was awful, counter person when checking in was not friendly at all and when we noticed a problem first walking in the door, told the person at counter, she was like, oh well, i'll have them spray the room. the room was so bad we needed another room, wasn't until later when i finally requested they give us another room did they with a different person behind the counter this time.

This hotel is not impressive from the entrance but we found the room clean and the service excellent....a very good value for the money. They offer a breakfast buffet for $14 in the restaurant next door but we walked the short distance to Mc Donalds for breakfast the 2 days we were there. One of the largest shopping malls "Ala Moana" is just a couple blocks away, we walked there for many choices to eat lunch/dinner. The concierge Michael went out of his way to get us to our luau on time.

Convenient location. Bathroom needs to be upgraded with exhaust fan & newer fixtures. Bathtub didn't drain well when showering. Friendly staff. Liked that there's a microwave & refrigerator in the room. They need a better scale to weigh luggage instead of a hand-held one.

The room was clean. All the usual amenities present in the bathroom. Internet was excellent, including an ethernet cable on the desk. Location on Ala Moana Blvd in central waikiki provides good acess to restaurants and shopping.

We stayed one night at this hotel. It is clean and comfortable. It is conveniently located, a couple of blocks from a nice section of the beach. It is also close to many restaurants. Staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. They let us check out a little late, store luggage, and use the pool on the afternoon after check out. The pool is on the second story, and it Is clean and refreshing. Shuttles are available to Pearl Harbor and the airport. The price was very reasonable for Honolulu, and unlike most hotels there, did not include a "resort fee." While this hotel does not have some of the amenities that some of the beachfront (and much more expensive) hotels offer, it is a very good choice for a short stay in Honolulu.

We stopped at this hotel for 2 nights i post cruise and 1 pre cruise.I think its ideal for this I wouldn't want to stop there for a week or so.The hotel is fine, clean and just 5 mins walk from the beach but is in need of a serious upgrade. It reminds me of a 1980/90's 4 star Spanish hotel.The rooms are large and bathrroms spacious evrything works but so outdated.Its 10-15 mins taxi ride from the cruise ports so ideal for that.Compared to other 4 start hotels around its good value for money.Staff are helpful and polite so no complaints there.

I am just very Happy with my Resort - Welcome by Staff - Reception staff were great - Tourist Agent had heaps of suggestions in places & ideas to do during my stay i did a day Trip to Pearl Harbour Memorials and enjoyed it - Coach driver also gave us City Tour on our return to Motel pick up area - I will go back to this Motel on a future Visit

Great location for food & waikiki beach easy walking distance,overall a very good property, would stay again.Breakfast next door was ok but not hot enough. Air conditioning in lobby towards lifts was far too cold after entering from outside.

We only stayed over one night for work so it was perfect as we were just there to sleep. Front desk workers were very nice and accommodated our requests for separate billings. Only down side was the parking fee of $28 per night. That was a pretty outrageous amount being that the parking was just a parking lot and not a covered parking structure.

Great location. 20 minutes walk to Waikiki beach. Clean hotel with good sized rooms and comfortable bed. Courteous staff, Convenient parking and lots of dining options in and around the hotel. We had a great stay, truly value for money.

We found this hotel through a timeshare presentation. It is right on the edge of Waikiki and in between Waikiki and the Alo Moano area. It’s within close walking distance to the beach, right off the Hawaiian Hilton resort. The rooms were very clean and updated with mini fridge and microwave. The facility had laundry facility, weight room and pool. Not good views but worth the discount. Lots of airline pilots and flight attendants staying here. Nice Concierge’s in the lobby. Steph welcoming and helpful. Lots Of traditional Hawaiian shops with great deals in the area away from the ABC stores.

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Waikiki recently and found it easy to get to from HNL airport. The location itself was very convenient. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff very professional and polite.

We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights....good points are friendly staff, very helpful at time of check in and check out . The lady at Tour desk helped us with our shuttle even if it wasn’t booked through her. Location is great and we had buffet lunch at Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel which was pretty decent. The negatives were that there was a big blot on carpet in the room which seemed like a botched up cleaning job , there were hair in the room and toilet was unclean. The aircon is very noisy so carry some earbuds. One morning we woke up to the sound of someone trying to smash through the window which was very frightening as we had watched the movie “ Hotel Mumbai” a few days back and current situation of worldwide terrorism is a real issue. When I opened the curtain, a window washer was cleaning our windows from outside....I think this should have been communicated to the guests beforehand as another guest confirmed a similar experience at his end with the sound on his window.

I loved my stay here and would definitely return. They offer a clean and affordable location in Waikiki. It is close to the beach, several ABC stores, and has the BEST parking. I loved the flat lot (not common) right near the entrance. I would return just for the easy parking! The staff were all so friendly and helpful. I had to leave luggage in the lobby one day and everything was fine. I also received an envelope from UPS with no issues. Thank you Ramada staff!

Most of the Waikiki hotels are much higher priced. We were very pleased to get such a nice room, for such a GREAT price ! This hotel is centrally located...Very convenient to the bus line AND within walking distance of many nice restaurants. We had an immediate response, to a minor problem we had, with the room air conditioner. You COULD spend more $$$...But, WHY ???

Super close to the beach. The room was very quiet and clean. No problems and the staff was very helpful and nice. No breakfast, but there is an iHop right next door. Computer and printer to check in for the flight home and great WiFi. Most affordable in Waikiki!

From a one-night business stay perspective, the location and comfort was great for the price. Staff was pleasant, got an upgrade to top floor and was treated like a business traveler and not a tourist. Room was quiet, A/C worked, multiple device charger cords, small frig, microwave. Hotel located between Kaio’o Drive and Ala Moana Blvd so it was easy for Uber/Lyft to get me to and from property and to walk around area. ABC stores are close by. Not my first choice for a business stay but would easy stay again if necessary.

Personally, I preferred the location of the hotel - close to the beaches and in walking distance to Ala Moana Center. An ABC Store is around the corner. Parking is at ground level which makes parking easy and fast and is 23 USD/d. Lobby is nice and updated. Coffee service is offered there until 10a. Rooms are clean, for my personal taste a little dated but absolutely acceptable for Ramada standards. Staff was overall ok - I missed the aloha-spirt. They are overall very stiff and I would not call them remarkably nice.I did not appreciate that my room has not been serviced for 2 days in a row as housekeeping wanted to do that after 5p when I needed the room. I told them one the first day that 5p is far too late which they did not understand because on the second day we had the similar situation. When I checked out, I told the lady at the front desk that I did not enjoy living for two days in an unserviced room. She did not seem interested just said sorry and swiped my credit card to charge me in full for my room and parking. I personally think that this is rude and inappropriate as I expect to receive full service for full payment. So, I contacted the management of the hotel later by eMail and received the copy-paste-answer (sorry, discuss with responsible department, hope to get a second chance) that you can read here in every negative review. I felt really offended by that because I take my time do describe a problem and receive an arrogant and standardized reply that demonstrates that even in management there is not seriously interested in customer claims. Later that day the lady sent me another eMail and copied the service report of the housekeeping in order to prove my a liar as the report stated that on the first day the do-not-disturb-sign was on all day (which is not true) and that I "refused" service (well, in the evening I need the room). That really turned me angry because I do not like to be called a liar based on untrue facts. Therefore, I contacted that management lady again and told her that I do not accept being treated like that and paying full price getting reduce service and I want to talk to the general manager. Then she offered me a refund of one full night or a free night for a future stay or reward points. As I'm decent I told her that I fell a full night of refund (150 USD) is too much for that incident and I would appreciate two days of no parking fee (46 USD) for two days of no service and that I do not want reward point as I don't use them and don't know if I want to return to their hotel again soon. Then she took her refund offer back, refused contact to the general manager of the hotel and just offered me reward points instead. Now that is completely weird and a mess and I personally feel fooled by that lady and ripped off by the hotel. They still owe me money. Contacting this management lady was the worst and most frustrating experience I ever had in customer service. She proves that the hotel is inattentive and not interested in the customers, their needs, their expectations and their claims. That really was a crazy and unique experience. Maybe corporate can handle that.

Only thing I’d change is the restaurant. But the location was so great that the several surrounding options were great and close.Overall good hotel, staff were nice and helpful! Excellent coffee( kona)!

If you're looking for a hotel to relax and spend most of your time in, this isn't it. If you'll be there to sleep and stop back in to refresh before heading out...this is the one! We were only there to sleep and get ready for the evening and this hotel was perfect. Great location on the edge of Waikiki and close to the Ala Moana mall. It's about a 10 minute walk from all the action in Waikiki.

Stayed here for two nights at the end of our stay in Hawaii. Greeted by receptionist who couldn’t even be bothered to look up from her desk. When asking for payment she told me my card had been declined and would not try again, I went to the ATM in reception and withdrew money without an issue. She was very rude. After a full day of travelling this is not the way you expect to be treated. Every other member of staff we came in contact with other than the lady who cleaned our room, did not speak and basically made us feel very unwelcome. Ruined our last two days in Hawaii. Rooms clean, with everything you need. Pool is in the back yard, didn’t look very nice so didn’t bother using it. We will NOT be returning
user_name:
Nicolearcher_x
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: With the Australian dollar exchange being so low, one tries to minimise costs and even budget hotels can be expensive. This Ramada takes many flight crews so that says something.Across the road from Hilton and near Prince Waikiki, it’s extremely well located. Bus stop outside to local malls ($2.50 a trip), and a good range of restaurants of all levels opposite. Local supermarket (ABC Store) has Good range of salads and reasonable range of healthy options. Rooms comfortable, good coffee, and importantly it has a self service laundromat Worked for us!

I stayed here for 2 nights for business. It located about 30 minutes away from the airport in the northern part of Waikiki. It is an older building but everything was nice and comfortably with no complaints.Pros:Good deal for a hotel in Waikiki - $150/night with AAA membership discountClean room, friendly serviceRestaurants close by – Chinese buffet right next door along with IHOP for breakfast. For Hawaiian food, there is Goofy’s across the street. Plenty of stores within 5-10 minutes walking, including a park, grocery store (Food Pantry), and a surf shop.The hotel has a gym but I did not visit, instead I jogged to a nice 24 hour fitness (supersport) that is about 0.7 miles away.Hotel offers valet service, there is also a concierge desk that will give you a free gift upon checking in. Lobby area is spacious and comfortable. Two elevators that are fast, never had to wait longer than 2 minutes to get around.Cons:No breakfast served although there are breakfast joints right next door. They do offer free coffee in the mornings.I would stay here again when I visit.

Ramada is based at the top end of Alamoana Blvd Waikiki.Literally walking distance to Alamoana Shopping Centre, Bus stop and trolley busesright outsideRooms are clean we were lucky to get a balconyStaff are very courteous and helpful Concierge was always ready to help never booked any tours as it was cheaper onlineKona Coffee in the lobby in the morning was greatLaundry facilities were always clean $2 wash $1.75 drier that lasted 63 mins which is a great dealPool area was always clean great to soak your feet after a marathon shopping day out or nice to have a quick dip after being at the beachRamada is in a great base to walk anywhere in Waikiki central

Friendly staff. Easy check in and out. Walking distance to everything we needed. Marina, beach, stores and restaurants. Appreciate the coffee and tea available every morning in lobby. Will stay here again

Hotel was clean, in a great location. It doesnt have food service or a restuarant.The staff is very friendly, helpful. The elevator was broke when we stayed (1 of 2)Parking fee is charged but as a windham member you do get a discount. Overall good place to stay and near many stores, resturants and the main street for driving

Very satisfying accommodation at a reasonable price. With a life spent staying in hotels around the world ranging from 5-stars to the lowest rating, this hotel felt as comfortable and homey as I would wish. Our rooms were spacious and clean, and all staff were friendly, with many willing to share information about some of their favorite hangout spots that are not on the usual list of high-price tourist traps. By Day 3 our meal expenses fell by 50%. Located across the street from other hotels costing twice as much, with the obvious major aesthetic difference being the size of their lobbies. Buses to everywhere from stop outside the front door. Will definitely stay there again.

I stayed three nights. Everything went well from check in to check out. The staff was friendly and gracious. The room was clean and service was great. Good location, within 15 minute walking distance of the Hawaii Convention Center where I was attending a conference, and close to the Waikiki beach. Highly recommended.

Very comfortable stay here as a base in Waikiki. A short stroll away from the beach and the main hotspots. The hotel is basic but well equipped. Was definitely a hotel and not a resort but the cost reflected that in comparison to others nearby. We used the pool which was generally quiet but most importantly was a great location for a base in this beautiful part of the world.

Stayed in Jan 2019... Basic, clean, tidy accomodation here with no frills. Breakfast is not included and usually an optional extra at the attached. Close to all the main Waikiki attractions, recommended for a budget stay with family, etc.

We stayed here for a week while on vacation, the hotel is a bit overpriced and dated but is clean, and the staff are nice. It is close to some shops and transit options, and across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has fireworks every Friday night which is great! 20min walk to the main Kuhio Beach & shopping strip.

We stayed on the 6th floor and the carpet at the end of the hallway (near our room) was mouldy. Our room also smelt dank and stale. Our rental car was also vandalised whilst parked in their carpark and they did not have surveillance camera coverage to assist us. Parking was also $28 a day which we thought was too expensive.

Good Service. Clean. Decent value for money. There is no restaurant attached. No Breakfast. But there is an IHOP next door. Convenient location.. Parking is 26$/day. Staff is polite. Overall a pleasant stay.

Our stay was very nice. Check in was quick and easy and they were very kind. The rooms were clean and the gym was large enough for our needs. The pool was cold but it is January. Rolls and coffee in the A.M lobby would benice to have. Over all it is a very nice hotel and we would stay again.

close to everything and priced right. nice and clean rooms. 10 min walk to the beach but just far enough not to be surrounded by crowds. download the Biki bike app and make use of the local bike share

I’d say the best part of this hotel would be its bed! There is a new GM running this hotel now and they’re renovating many things and have had installed new furniture in the lobby. There will be a new elevator around middle of 2019. This hotel is a family friendly hotel. The bed is of the same type as a 5 Star hotel. Highly recommended!

Being a Wyndham Rewards member, I try to stay at Wyndham affiliated properties. This is an older hotel, but many of the hotels in Waikiki are older. The hotel had been renovated in the previous year, so it was very nice and homey in feel. I liked the décor and the friendliness of the employees from Manager to the cleaning team. It was conveniently located to the Hawaiian Hilton Village which was across the street. There was plenty of shopping and even though it was not on the beach, I felt that it was a whole lot easier to access the beach from this property than from others. Recommendations regarding restaurants were excellent and location going either direction from the hotel was great. I will stay there again when in Waikiki.

A short walk to the beach and marina parking for $1/hr. In the heart of the Waikiki resorts and shops without the extreme costs. Hotel and service was top-notch, and I recommend this hotel to everyone!

I stayed one night at this hotel and was quite happy with my experience. The check in staff were friendly and even told me my room would be ready an hour early, so that was exciting. Check-in is at three and the check out is noon. It seems like it’s standard practice to try and get the rooms turned around earlier if possible when the hotel is able to do so. The room itself was a good size and although The furnishings and carpet were quite dated everything was clean and in good shape. The TV and super comfy bed were modern. I was also impressed that the window in the room opened a bit. The windows weren’t in the best shape but did the job. My one complaint about the room was that the bathtub did not have a drain stopper, that was disappointing.The pool area was overall pretty nice so I could see them needing more umbrellas for shade in the summer. I was very disappointed that the pool is not heated in the winter time many people came out and dipped their feet in the pool but no one (myself included) went in due to it being so cold. Surely a large hotel chain could offer that especially in Hawaii! The hotel itself doesn’t offer anything other than coffee and tea I would’ve liked to have some kind of breakfast option even for a small price.The location is overall very excellent it’s about a 25-30 minute drive from the airport very easily to access by bus or taxi. There are several shops and restaurants near the hotel itself and a large upscale shopping center as well as a pharmacy and other restaurants about a 15 minute walk away. Overall I thought this was a pretty good budget hotel that felt very clean and very friendly in a great area. I’d stay again!

Room is clean. Onsite laundry is a plus. The gym is a little small and smells. The parking is not good: $28/night. Hotel staff didnot offer alternatives. Found out the garage next door only charges $15.

I stayed here on NYE. The room itself was fine if a bit average for the price being charged per night (although understandably they charge Waikiki prices). What was disappointing was the lack of customer service throughout our stay. There was nothing egregious but lots of little things that would make me not recommend staying here. For example when we checked in the front desk handed us the room key and moved away without telling us the room number of where the lifts were located. Or the bellboy who made it seem like a massive inconvenience that we were storing bags for the day. Consistently the staff did not make us feel welcomed.

Limited view as top floor is 17th and surrounded by other hotels. No breakfast included but also no resort fees. Parking available for fee. Small rooms but clean. Both microwave and fridge. Excellent for the price.

They have good rooms. Good bathrooms. The pillows is comfortable, bed are soft and comfortable. It's just they don't have there own restaurants. There swimming pools are very nice. The room is pretty big, and they have nice room service.

For your privacy make sure you latch the door to you room. We had one of the cleaning personnel open our door without knocking. My kids were in the room playing while we were getting ready when thieves happened. Parking was crazy expensive!

Poor customer services. Staff not looking unhappy and rude. Not very helpful in guiding your way to places you want to visit. Location is far from beach and shopping centres. Every interesting place is 20 minutes walk away.

My stay was very enjoyable the staff was helpful and professional. The room was clean and we'll maintained. I would recommend this location to friends and family traveling to this area. The staff helped me navigate the area and made some recommendations for resteraunts and shopping on the area. The hotel was convenient to the Highway. And major streets.

Ramada Plaza is at a good location. The waikiki beach is only 10 minutes walking distance. The room was well kept and had all the amenities- toiletries, hair dryer, safe, microwave, mini fridge, study table and chair. The housekeeping was prompt and the room was always well kept and clean. The receptionists welcomed me warmly and were always very prompt with any queries that I had. It was a great stay!

This is just an average hotel in a good location. We were part of an organised tour so didn’t have the option of choosing our Waikiki stay but obviously lots of tour groups use this particular hotel as groups were constantly coming and going. Would rather have paid more as the rooms are very average indeed

Great staff and clean room。Very convenient for my visit purposes. Walking distance to almost all aspects of Waikiki within few miles and minutes.Easy in and out out of parking area with staff on duty.

Clean and spacious enough rooms. Air conditioner is noisy but otherwise it is a good hotel. There are rooms with balconies which we couldn’t upgrade to due to availability but I reckon it is worth the extra $20 a night to be able to let some air in the room!Beds are comfortable and bathroom is compact but clean. Location is good - can get to most things easily enough. Recommend for short stays.

Good room, very clean, again awesome staff. Within walking distance to all of Waikiki. Secure parking. fax available. Good WiFi in rooms, Many cable Stations. Really great reasonable rates. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed for 5 nights. Unfortunately, they could not accommodate early check in even though we informed at the time of booking. It's about 20 minutes from the airport on a bustling street about 10 minutes walk to the beach (A little tricky to get to the beach). ABC Stores to get anything you need right around the corner. The rooms are large and well equipped with everything you will need for a comfortable stay. Only problem, after 9 am room service will open the door with their key without knocking, which isn't expected.Don’t expect a glamour hotel expect a hotel that is safe comfortable and does the job. Air condition is a little loud and it took awhile to cool room. Ice machine was on the second floor only. Laundry room was clean and stocked with change machine and detergent for purchase ( didn't use service). There is outdoor pool (didn't swim there). Wifi good in room and weak in lobby. Parking will cost you $25 extra per night. But if you are already member of the hotel chain then it is free. However , if you register as member at the time of arrival it is $20.No breakfast being served. Only tea/coffee at the foyer in the mornings. I hop and McDonald not far if that’s what you are into. There is a Chinese restaurant attached (with discount for hotel guest). There are eating establishments within walking distance about 15-30 minutes depending on how fast you walk. The property is also right on trolley pick up points (all 5 trolley service, $5.5 per route at). It is plus point for those who didn't want to hire car (download the app,DaBus2). From the airport you can book a ride in advance $10 per person or many taxi service provider who charges $23 for taxi.This feels more like an upmarket motel rather than a hotel so adjust your expectations accordingly. However it’s about half the price of other Waikiki hotels so you get what you pay for. We aren't sure whether we will return to the hotel.

I recently stayed for 4 nights. We arrived early and realised that checkin was not until 3pm which appeared to be late. We returned at 130pm and asked if a room was ready. We we’re told no it wasn’t, tried again at 230, still not ready then at 310 it was ready. The lady at the reception desk could not have cared in the least about it. This part was disappointing. All other stay were extremely helpful and happy. The rooms have everything that you require. The coffee machines in the rooms were great. The pool level has a vending machine, ice machine and washing machines for your clothes. Uber pickups and drop offs were easy to arrange. I would stay at this hotel in the future pending on an upgrade or the price.

The location is perfect for access to the surrounding attractions, both in walking and driving. The on site parking is effective. We were here a week previously then went to a different island. We enjoyed the time here so much that we came back for another 5 day stay. This accommodation is excellent for an order couple because it is quiet and not noisy like some places.

Nice, clean and tidy room, friendly and helpful staff and easy walk to beach and shopping. A little bit of road noise and air cond was a bit noisy but not unbearable. Found it strange that tea and coffee were supplied but no milk, there was creamer but tea and creamer are not a good brew.

Couple of my close friends and I were visiting Hawaii from US, Canada and India respectively, to make the week special for our friend, whose birthday was that week. It was our first time in Hawaii and we were excited as anybody else would be. We were staying at this underlying hotel for 4 nights. The hotel had very basic facilities, bad toiletries, no breakfast facility or water jugs / bottles in the room, which was unlike other Ramada properties.Last day when we had to check out, just like you would do it with any other hotels in the world, we left our luggage with a bell boy at the reception, and decided to go for a small walk at the beach. Just few hours before we had to depart for the airport, on arriving back at the hotel, we noticed that from my friend’s backpack an expensive Carabiner Clip (purchased from SUPERDRY) was missing. He had clipped that to his cabin bag before leaving, which meant that an intended attempt was made to steal it. On asking the staff members, they denied that they had seen anything. When we asked for the manager, they said there was no manager on duty as it was a weekend, which sounded fishy. We also asked to see the CCTV footage between that hour but knowing we had to leave for the airport, the movement among the staff intentionally became slow, a member went to our room instead to look for the clip and we never got a clear answer. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE! and take care of you belongings. #Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Waikiki

I was visiting with my friends who had flown all the way from India and Canada, to make the week special for me as it was my birthday. It was our first time in Hawaii and we were equally excited as any body else would be. We were staying at the hotel for 4 nights. Last day when we had to check out, just like all the hotels in the world, we left our luggage with the bell boy at the reception, and decided to go for a small walk at the beach. Hours before we had to depart for the airport. On arrival, I noticed that from my bag-pack a Carabiner Clip (purchased from SUPERDRY expensive one) was missing. The funny thing is, I had clipped that to my cabin bag before leaving. That means an intended attempt was made to steal it. On asking the staff they obliviously denied that they have not seen anything. When I asked for a manager, they said there was no manager on duty as it was a weekend. I was not surprised. But it sounded fishy. I did ask to see the CCTV footage between that hour but knowing we had to leave for the airport the movement among the staff intentionally got slow and I never got any answers. It was just ridiculous. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE. Take care of you belongings. #Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Waikiki

Old and tired hotel... Furniture in lobby, halls, pool and rooms severely outdated. TVs were of good size and current tech. Room closets were very reminiscent of a dorm closet.
