You could literally put this hotel anywhere in the world and it wouldn't feel out of place but this is Hawaii and you feel like it should have something a bit extra.If you like a game of chance then try getting a coffee in the lobby, the facilities seem to make fandom appearances, I couldn't find any pattern but I was only there for a short while, or maybe you are thirsty, Hawaii is hot so dehydration is a certainty and cold water is provided only in a cup the size of a large thimble, seemed pointless and petty water cannot be that expensive.Overall the hotel is well placed and good for a couple of days.

Before arriving at the hotel, my shuttle bus driver joked at my hotel choice. Check in counter was rude. There’s a nice way of letting me know that there isn’t the possibility of an early check-in, even if I’m willing to pay. Cleaning staff was rude and unprofessional. Cleaning staff held an elevator for a couple of minutes to let all the other employees on. Cleaning staff was angry at us for choosing a late checkout which I asked the front desk for. She knocked on my door and rudely asked when I was going to leave. She later stared at us in anger as we left. Staff was unhelpful on giving directions to the beach. Directions were “across the street” or “walk through the Hilton”. We actually found it easier to walk down Hobron Ln and Holomoana st. There were only two staff members that were nice on the last day of our 6 day trip. Hotel is worn, I didn’t want to sit on any of the chairs. The room was clean, but the bed frame’s cloth was incredibly dirty. This hotel caters to large tour groups from China. These guests often left their doors open and called to each other down the hall at all hours of the night. Location wise, the hotel is decent. From leaving the room and finding a spot on the beach takes about 15-20 minutes even when going through the Hilton.

This is a nice hotel. The staff is great. The beds are only full size not queen. The room's amenities do not afford it to be ranked higher. However, for the price and location on Oahu. It is a great place to consider to stay.

Fabulous resort with great amenities. The room was clean and well presented with a mini fridge and a coffee maker. The coffee was replenished every day. The bed was king size with awesome pillows and very comfy. The staff were very friendly. There is a laundry room, and pool with loungers. I thought the location was great with easy walking to Ala Moana shopping centre, and heaps of fabulous eateries close by. Easy walking to the beach, and shopping in general. I thought the resort was excellent value for money and will stay again. In particular I really liked the selection in the little gift shop.

My room was next to the elevator. I’m a light sleep so I heard a lot of the people traffic to and from the elevator. Luckily my stay was only for one day. In the future, I will request a different room.

I never knew that his property existed at its locations. Always thought that it was occupied by apartments and condos. What a surprise, not to mention, if you understand the morning and evening gridlock of Waikiki, this place is a gem (multiple avenues to come and go) and I'd say a majority of the locales from the neighbor islands visiting Honolulu don't know about it! Shiiii, don't tell! Otherwise the prices will go UP!

I've stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki a few times and it is a great bargain for a hotel in Waikiki. Convenient location, clean room, friendly staff, fridge, microwave, and free bottled water in the room!

Ramada is perfectly situated to all locations you need in Wakakii.Eating places, beach,shopping & transport.The hotel is in a quiet area, just have to deal with the inflow of loud Chinese guestsbut the friendliness of staff & locals make up for that.Last visit we stayed at the Hawaiian Hilton Village across the road from the Ramada & this hotel has all the qualities, & more so than a place you just pay for a name & statice.Ramada has lovely comfortable beds & pillows,its very clean & I check behind beds etc.Housekeeping do a great job looking after our rooms.Yes have to agree rooms need upgrading, but cleanliness & price is my priority.
Great location to the beach , shopping center , and great dining in the area too !! It's in walking distance to Waikiki area , and is also on the bus route to anywhere you need to go !!!!!!!!
Bed was comfortable, very clean, just a little out dated...could use some upgrades but overall it was great.

Housekeeping staff were attentive and efficient. parking attendant recognized us during our stay,front desk took care of check in /out. over all the hotel ran well even when we had a power outage which was a bit of concern. hotel has no control over the culture of people staying at the hotel, however chinese patrons are a bit too loud, perhaps the tour agency can do some courtesy suggestions before trips. impress by air crew in and out of the hotel in a quiet and efficient way even with their luggage. we were there for 11 days.

I would pick a different hotel if you can afford it. This was old, worn, outdated, and in need of a good cleaning. The location was not on the beach, and we could not see the beach from our room. The only things going for this hotel are that it is relatively inexpensive for Waikiki and the staff was very nice and helpful.

We stayed here in a small group and had 2 rooms. The hotel placed us close together which was really thoughtful and handy. One room was a bit musty and we had to keep the window open but it was definitely clean (might be time for the carpet to be replaced)! Service was good. The location is walking distance (5 mins) to ala moana shopping center and you can access the beach via the hilton complex. Its also closer to Pearl Harbor, the airport and Aloha stadium than other hotels.There are some good restaurants nearby and its a short uber or 15 min walk to the middle of WaikikiIts a hotel not a resort but is priced accordingly. I’m a Ramada fan generally for their value and this didn’t disappoint
user_name:
wilminskyj
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: This hotel was ok for the price. Nothing fancy at all, very basic but clean. Asked to check in an hour early after a long flight and the hotel was not able to accommodate that request.

I could stay so comfortable and had relaxed vacation. I would like to stay again. The front persons are so kind. When I checked in, they tell me to join group membership of hotel and be able to get discount fee of park lot. The room is clean and refrigerator and microwave available. You can go to duke Kahanamoku beach by walk only in 5 mins. The pinkline bus is available and You can walk to DFS and Royal Hawaiian Center in 15 mins.

Good value hotel---not fancy and room not large, but reasonably priced for Waikiki and hotel does not charge an extra "resort fee" (unlike a lot of hotels in Waikiki). Room is fine and air conditioner worked well. Staff was nice and helpful. Location is fine---although not right on the beach, the beach is not too far away. Waikiki isn't big, so it isn't too much effort to get anywhere in Waikiki. Gripes: window lock was not working, in-room safe was malfunctioning and not useable, no desk. Also stayed at the Equus hotel which is very close to the Ramada, but preferred the Ramada. Ramada was definitely quieter because it is farther back from Ala Moana Blvd. In the future would stay at the Ramada again.
Consider to the price, I shouldn't expect too much but the overall rating of my experience with Ramada is not too pleasant. The air conditioning was very loud and the pillows were too high.

The hotel is located in a location not very far from Waikiki beach. The staff from manager to the parking attendant are very helpful and friendly. All the necessary services provided on site except breakfast which is provided by a separate Chinese restaurant. The breakfast menu very suitable for those who love Chinese food. We skipped it.

It was a nice stay over. We arrived when the power went out and elevator wasn’t working. We walked up to the 14th floor. We get to the room and the AC unit wasn’t working. But it was working when we returned to our room.
Great location and very friendly and helpful staff. The only negative are that rooms are small and dated but overall clean and comfortable beds.
This hotel was a great place to base our sight-seeing from. Close to everything and comfortable for sleeping at night. We would return on a future visit for sure.
Great location, easy to walk to the beach! Great part of town. Clean location. Easy pay parking.
The hotel was a nice, clean and well priced option for an overnight stay while on my way to Maui.
We enjoyed staying at the Ramada in Waikiki very much but kind of thought the parking should have been included
Excellent stay at this Ramada Plaza Waikiki. Encountered no problems at all. The staffs are very friendly and helpful.

Excellent place to stay. Great friendly staff especially the conceige's. It's not a flashy accommodation but it does the job as good as the flashy neighbours. It is still a 5 minute walk to the beach and it has its own pool. We walked to the middle of waikiki shopping area for shopping and restuarts. It's clean, tidy but a bit tired. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It fitted our budget well.

The hotel is a short walk to the beach, shopping and fantastic restaurants (Marakume Udon, Musubi Cafe, Goofy's Cafe). The room was clean and the bedding was comfortable. The king room we stayed in had a decent sized balcony. We enjoyed the stay using reward points. Bo at the front desk was so sweet, we were able to check in 1 hr early to get ready for our friends wedding.
user_name:
K3885FQcatherinew
New York City, New York

review_body: We wanted a place to stay while in Waikiki that was within our budget and this place fit the bill. The fabric on the chairs in the room were a little worn, but other than that it was great. Friendly helpful staff. Within walking distance to many ABC stores and the beach and multiple places to eat.

Would have thought a Ramada would be better. A/C smelled like mold. Window didn't close tightly, heard outside noises all night. Furniture was all worn. Definitely needs updating. No view of the water. View into other peoples room. Had no idea I would have to pay extra for parking. Front desk, not clear about directions, where to park, where to go for my room, etc.

Everyone were wonderful. Joel in the lobby was always there to help me. If I came in with packages, he took them up for me. He was always there to call me a cab, or if I had questions he helped me. He is an asset to the Ramada,Mila was also wonderful. She came in everyday to clean and bring in fresh towels and coffee etc. Always asking me if I needed anything. One morning I did need some help, and I heard her in the hall, I opened my door and told her I needed some help. She came in and was right there to help. Thank you Mila. I needed a box to put things in for mailing. She was right there with three different size boxes for me asking what size I needed, The lady in the gift shop had wide tape and loaned me her roll to seal my box.Could I ask for anything more then all these special people at my side? No, I would not. They are special and Ramada should be thankful for having them. It was a great three weeks for me.I did not mention I'm handicapped, and thank God they were all there helping me and taking care of me. I thank them and thank the Ramada Plaza for hiring such nice people. Give them all a raise. They deserve it. Thank you to all of you at the front desk who were also very friendly and helpful.Regards, Millie Mascot
check-in was a breezehad a a/c unit in the room that wouldn't adjust the temp. but livable al the rest of the amenities were greatno transportation to and from the airport ( extra $60. )

We stayed at the Ramada for two nights before departing from Hawaii - it is a good value for money hotel in a good location - so close to beach, shopping, restaurant. Staff were friendly and helpfulAlthough we did have one problem - we wanted two glasses to drink some wine whilst resting & watching the US open tennis. Sorry could not help - got the impression it was a wierd request - there are no glasses in the hotel !!!!Hotel is also a bit dated but I suppose that keeps the price reasonable

Lobby was nice, front desk was friendly and efficient.. rooms were outdated but comfortable although air con wasn't the greatest. Would stay again, hotel did the job and it's a great location for price ( although parking is 25$)

Hawaii is a fairly expensive place to stay, so whilst this hotel was a little tired it was great value for money. Rooms were a good size and service was good. It is in a handy spot. It is not a resort style though it is simply a hotel.
user_name:
Derek M
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

review_body: We stayed here in Sept when the weather was pretty hot. The accommodations were decent for the price. The only con was the a/c. It wasn't on when we arrived and kept shutting off throughout the night. We had to get up to turn it on or bare the heat.

This hotel is a very nice hotel. Male Reception staff very helpful, smiling and courteous as for the female staff they should take a leaf out of their male counterparts. Hardly a smile !!Rooms were good, but these hotels do not cate for breakfasts and I think this should be add.3 - 4 pm checking in time is not good. We had a long flight and would have preferred the rooms to be ready at least by 12 noon.
Excellent location, clean, and friendly, helpful staff. Will definitely stay again. No complaints at all.

Great location - hotel is just outside, but within walking distance to Waikiki, so it was very easy to get in/out of the neighbourhood with a car (we had a rental) as we avoid the traffic jam across Waikiki area. $20 parking for Wyndham Reward members ($25 for non-members), and no resort fees which is a positive to us. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean and in decent shape. Great to have fridge (small cube one) and microwave for leftovers. A bit of street noise but we were on the 15th floor so it was minimal. Two elevators but they were very fast! Laundry room was clean and stocked with change machine and detergent for purchase, opens to the outdoor pool (although we didn't swim there).. Wifi good in room, weak and sometimes close to none in lobby. Steps to McDonald's and the ABC Stores that seem to be on every street! Walkable to Ala Moana Shopping Centre - great food court and shopping. We were across the street from H*lton Hawaiian Village for beach access. We didn't swim at the beach but it was a very nice stroll along the strip which connects to Waikiki beach itself. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Honolulu - the hotel fits our travel style very well. We enjoyed day trips to the beaches on the North shore and east side of the island so the hotel is good for a rest for another day of touring. Folks who prefer resort-style vacation (albeit with lots of people) and access to lots of expensive shops would enjoy the hotels right at Waikiki better.
Room was nice. Beds were comfortable with fitted bottom sheets. Refrigerator and microwave in room and a large flat screen TV

All the staffs was very friendly and courteous. It was nice location across from the beach and near everything. You an catch the trolley up and down the shopping center. The room was nice and clean. We stay 6 days. It got 2 double beds, refrigerator, microwave. It was 3 of us and we have plenty of room.

The double beds are too small for 2 people. The bathroom was not clean. The air conditioner in the first room was broken. Moved to another room and the air worked however, it leaked water all over the floor and on personal items.

Set on a busy road, above ihop, walking distance to ala moana shopping (10 mins) and waikiki beach/honolulu zoo (20 minutes). Concierge and parking staff are very easy going, friendly and helpful. Reception were courteous. Pool was cute - your average "backyard type" pool size. Small gym. Buffet and bar downstairs. $25 parking per day, we got it for $20 but I cant remember the reason - I think Margaret at reception said it was because we were guest of the hotel? I asked if bookings were busy, Margaret said it was "ok". We are a family of 4. 2 adults 2 "tweens". We booked a two double bedroom and requested a room away from the lift or where there would be less traffic/noise. However, we were allocated a room right next to the lift (room 1501). The room was very small. Very small narrow wardrobe. We had a microWave and fridge. No balcony. We had 8 checkin bags and 4 cabin bags, so it was very nice that most of the bags were taken up for us - we tipped the nice guy of course. Same thing when we left, different nice guy and tipped him too - those bags were heavy!! Tipping is "expected" but sometimes I honestly think attitude of some staff anywhere is appauling and dont feel it is fair we are expected to tip them. It is more satisfying when even if they are slow or do something by mistake, or even superfast and make a mistake but you can clearly see they keep a positive attitude and try, that tipping on top of your bill is a good thing. Parking is on site. Overall stay was pleasant

Although looking dated, the hotel was clean and in a good location for Waikiki.Easy access onto Waikiki Beach via the Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach Resort.Bus to Pearl Harbour stops right outside the hotel.Hotel staff were helpful when needed.

Ramanda is a perfect hotel located at start of Waikiki. It's a walk away from the major shopping mall and Waikiki strip. The hotel is clean, the lobby is beautiful considering it being a smaller hotel, the staff were helpful and friendly, and the room was clean, roomy and comfortable. The only problem I had was paying $20 per day for parking that was limited and with stalls that were quite narrow for even a small corolla like ours. Overall, I loved it and will probably stay there at out next trip.

Always know what to expect with a Ramada, a good standard hotel. Air conditioning was very noisy and j suggest the hotel look into replacing these. Pool was good, staff nice and friendly and was clean

It was nice. Hotel rooms could use a little updating. Fabric worn on chairs. Pillows were stinky. It's just a standard hotel room with 90s decor. But, I felt safe there and it was quiet. It also was only about a 2 block walk from the beach. I was charged a weird "transient" tax, which offended me at first. I'm not a transient! :))
The hotel property is just okay. The room and hallway need better decorations and coloration. Of the 2 elevators, only one was working.
The internet connection was really bad, and we were not happy about this. Maybe be you can consider setting separate Wifi for every room.

We stayed 2 nights here and went to north end of the island for 1 night and coming back for another 2 nights here. The location is not as convenient as in center Waikiki if you are a beach person. but For us, we like driving around the city and exploring, so we are very satisfied with everything here. Staffs are friendly, room was clean, there's always a staff at the corner outside of the hotel which makes you feel secure for your stay and your car. Lots of restaurants around with walking distance. Will definitely recommend to others.

Nice, comfortable hotel with an exceptional staff, but for us the location was the finest feature. We had 10 members of our senior softball team stay at the Ramada, and we all took off in different directions after our games. Restaurants, shopping, sight seeing all within easy access. Thoroughly enjoed our stay.
Convenient location. Walkable distance to many good options. Close to the beach. Friendly staff. Rooms a tad bit dated.

Stayed here for two nights while visiting Honolulu. The location appeared to be central to everything. We did tours both days that picked us up across the street a half block down. The rooms were clean, although small. But it met our needs for this leg of our trip.

We stayed here two nights at the beginning and at the end of stay in Hawaii. We stayed in late July and early August (during US school holidays). As it was late summer the hotel was fully booked for early check ins (which is not guaranteed prior to arrival as most hotels) so if arriving early book an extra night to guarantee an early check in.We arrived 10 hours prior to check in and were lucky to check in at 12:00 instead of at 3pm. The hotel has no onsite eateries but you do get a 30% discount at Wok Kiki all you can eat chinese buffet. There's heaps of places to eat locally so step out of the resort and explore.Waikiki is a short walk and it's opposite the Hilton Hawaiian village which is great for a browse. There's a bus stop right in front of the hotel and most of the trolleys pass by as well. Ala Moana shopping centre is a 5 minute walk and Honolulu is on the other side of the hotel so I find it a great spot to get to and from especially from the airport.A very reasonably priced hotel for the facilities including Gym, pool, laundry etc. The reception is 24 hours. It does need a little face lift in the rooms but it's no less than the equivalent of Hawaiian hotel rooms. We would definitely stay again.

We have no complaints. If your budget is $115/night and this hotel is available, book it. It may be the best price available for the room quality in Waikiki. The A/C was fairly loud but it served as needed white noise to block the very loud city sounds at night. The A/C worked great. The bathroom was clean and not at all cramped. The bedroom was nicely appointed and the king bed and bed clothes were very comfortable. You may need to remember to ask for extra pillows and blankets. The front desk staff and parking lot attendant, all of them, were outstanding. Five stars there. Parking was $25 a night which is typical for the area. There was no resort fee. This was important for us. We will definitiely stay here again assuming a similar nightly rate, will will recommend this hotel in Waikiki.

This hotel is one of the cheapest hotel in Honolulu because probably it's one of the oldest hotel in that location but it's clean, spacious and quiet. The most important part is that all their staff is amazing. When you checked in you really feel welcomed and when I ask some interesting site to visit the front desk who checked me in gives me a map and show me all the things I should visit and how to get there. And, when we have change of plan when we get to Kauai and need to go back to Oauhu a day earlier and ask them if I can get the same room rather than move to a different room the next day they did everything on their capabilities to let us stay in the same room even the room that we have that time is more expensive compared to the one that we really booked. That's what I called quality service. Location in the heart of Waikiki, just 7-10 minutes walk from the hotel. Thumbs up to all the staff. We will really stay there again next time we visit Oauhu.

This is a clean, centrally located hotel very near Waikiki beach and all of the excursions we signed up for were very near to us. Lots of good restaurants and activities in the area.The hotel room itself was spacious and had everything we needed. Most of the other reviews do a great job of listing the pros and cons so I won't be redundant.One point of annoyance, though, was that twice we ordered a taxi as we were running quite late (once for an excursion, the other to get to the airport for our departing flight). I didn't have my phone available so I couldn't hire Uber so we asked the concierge to book us a taxi. Both times, once we got into the car and got to our location, the taxi informed us that they don't take credit cards. I'm not used to this arrangement as in nearly every country we travel (and we travel a lot) taxis offer credit card transactions. Both taxis they ordered were cash only. We live in Australia so we don't carry US currency with us and this put us in a real bind. I had to end up paying a big fee and it cost us tons of time both times trying to get this sorted. I almost missed my excursion. I don't know why the concierge doesn't ask if we have cash or try to arrange a ride that accepts credit card. This may seem minor, but we were put into a real bind twice and it seems like a very fixable issue. Other than that, though, we don't really have any complaints. I would stay here again--and make sure to have my phone to book an Uber. :)

I was offered 2 free nights for attending a Wyndham presentation. I tried to get reservations at the more upscale hotels but no rooms were available even though I checked for availability early enough (I thought) for the whole month of July and (offer expires in) August. I booked at Ramada and for the price I can't complain. The desk people were super friendly and courteous. The room is a little dated but clean and the bed was comfortable. Housekeeping staff were also very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. BTW I and my daughter are local residents of Hawaii.
great was close to downtown and the beaches. Hard to get out of after parkinbg. Scaped the side of our car on the pole trying to make the turn

The hotel's location is great. It's away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki yet within walking distance from the Ala Moana shopping center and Ala Moana Boulevard had some great restaurant options. The room is quite small and average but fine for a few days stay. One small problem I had was the sound of the AC in the room. It was fairly loud.

A little hard to see address, but once you find it, you are good to go! Become a Wyndham member so you can get discounted parking. Staff very nice and helpful. Room a little small, but a/c worked great! Small microwave, fridge and safe in room. Pool was nice and laundry was also available on the second level. If you could cross the street by the hotel, would have a short walk to the beach, but unfortunately can't cross there and have to go a block or so out of the way.

I was very happy to have the mini fridge and microwave. The pillows were not my favorite and some of the furnishings were fraying. It was in a location where there were lots of restaurants and shopping but it took forever to get out of Waikiki to get to locations on other parts of the island (that's a negative for the area that's not unique to this hotel). The staff was great though!
Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. But housekeeping role one of our device chargers. And the rooms are EXTREMELY small.
Hotel needs to be updated. Your paying for the location, not much else. Parking lot attendants are rude. Sundry shop is small and hardly open, closes way to early.
Great family vacation. Right across the street from the beach. Bus stop right on front of hotel.

The front desk people were friendly and helpful, including storing our luggage until check-in time. The room was somewhat small, but certainly big enough for the two of us. We did a lot of walking, and found our hotel convenient to the beach and shopping areas.

Our first trip to Hawaii turned out to be a memorable experience. Checked in with family and proceeded to our room on the 11th floor. Room was right next to elevators which I had requested not to be near. I went downstairs and Gene, manager on duty was quick to apologize and changed my room to the 9th floor away from the elevators. Didn't like the fact the new room was an adjoining room but did not go back downstairs. My husband stated it was fine and I left it at that, The hotel does need a serious makeover on the outside. The rooms are outdated but kept clean and well equipped with supplies. Did not use pool nor exercise room. Did use the laundry room. This came in handy because I did not want to travel with dirty clothes back home. Wifi a little slow. Air condition was a little loud and it took awhile to cool room. The hotel is within walking distance to Waikiki Beach, ABC store (which has other items besides alcohol). There are eating establishments within walking distance about 15-30 minutes depending on how fast you walk. We dined at Cheeseburger Waikiki which is about a 20 minute walk. Red Lobster and Buffalo Wild Wings are also in the area. We ate at Wok KiKi Buffet and Bar which is located beside the hotel and offers a 30% discount when you present your Ramada Plaza Hotel key. We only ate breakfast there because we were out all day. We were impressed with the food. We scheduled tours online instead of dealing with the vendors on the streets. Make sure to grab a visitors guide in hotel lobby which contain discounts to activities. The hotel does not have shuttle service. We used Speedi Service from the airport to the hotel which was $15.00 per person. Don't know the rate if you are a large group. Overall, good experience. BTW, I'm a guest of color and didn't experience any racial issues. Will be back when hotel has a makeover.

A really good hotel to stay, easy walk to beach and town . Rooms clean and well equipped , staff really helpful and friendly , car parking charges a little high but all hotels charge the same to park anyway , overall a really pleasant stay thanks
My family stayed one night for a layover in Hawaii. It's clean but dated. As long as your expectations are appropriate, this place will meet all your basic needs.

This place smells fonky and they are super racist towards African Americans so if your of color and looking for a good night's rest I recommend you do not stay at this hotel.Your better off staying at a motel 6 for this price

For the price your paying you would expect much more. The staff is very friendly and I give them 5 stars. The building is very old and dated and could use a refresh. The rooms definitely could use a refresh as they are very dated.

We had a great hotel experience. The staff were friendly and helpful Our room was clean and always prepared in a good amount of time. I would stay here again. My only recommendation is that our kitchen area could use a bit of a facelift, otherwise it is a great hotel to stay in.

This was only an overnight stay on my way to Japan, but the short time I was there the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly! I will definitely be using this hotel again in the future when I return to Hawaii!

Older hotel and showing it. Dirty worn furniture, 1980's style air conditioner, dorm room appearance of walls in the room, watered down coffee, incomplete in room drink set to make regular coffee or tea. Staff was great to work with but most lacked clean & professional appearance. More Motel 6 than Ramada in everyway.
I had a 2-day business trip and needed a place to stay. The price was reasonable as well were the accommodations.

This was the most convenient hotel closest to many restaurants. Although you can easily get lost finding your way around the back, it's much easier if you come around on Ala Moana Blvd. The parade was wonderful just outside the hotel. The rooms could use some remodeling, but otherwise a good place to stay for a short time.
The was a great value for the price. Hotel was located close to all the attractions, it was very nice, comfortable, and clean. The staff showed great hospitality.

Hotel is within easy walking distance of the beach, Friday night fireworks on the lagoon, downtown Waikiki is duke statue. Rooms are reasonably clean. Daily maid service was excellent. Plenty of towels in the room and at the pool. Laundry facilities were great as we been traveling for 2 weeks. Free coffee in the lobby each morning. Discount on parking if a Wyndham rewards member.

I'd heard great things about Wyndham hotels. This was not too of the line. The staff was very friendly. They were most accommodating for anything we asked of them. The hotel is old and it shows in the rooms.

You aren't right on the beach at this hotel but the price is good for Waikiki and you are just across the road from the Hilton Hawaiian Village complex. You can stroll through their beautiful gardens to the beach and visit the restaurants there without paying their accommodation prices! This end of Waikiki is the nicest, at the other end hotels are crammed in close to the water and the beach is very narrow and crowded.

This hotel is very well located, walking distance to beach, shops and restaurants. The staff is very polite and very kind! The room is clean and spacious. On my next visit I would stay here again. I recommend this hotel!

Stayed here for 7 nights and had great service from the start . Got to check in early which was great and fantastic service from staff . Rooms are good sized and good amenities considering no resort tax!! Good location and good value for money

Stayed there for one week. Comfortable double bed, janitor had been cleaning my room everyday. The reception provided sample toothpastes and plastic cutlery if you forgot to bring. Excellent WiFi coverage. The room shows some age but acceptable. Being a very light sleeper, the only issue I had was the loud noise of the large 'air conditioner', it didn't look like a split unit, luckily fixed on the floor level as there's no remote control. It should be a good location if you preferred visiting shopping centre to the beach.
Though the hotel is centrally located the front desk was pleasant and willing to help. Parking was expensive and limited. No restaurant for room service. I saw a few crawlers on my last night.

I stayed here for one night because I had a Military event to attend which was only a 2min walk from Ramada. No issues except checking in-- requested early check-in days in advance, but when I got there, my room wasn't ready and wouldn't be ready for another 2 hrs. Had this happened, I would have missed my event. Minded, I had just traveled 11hrs on a plane, so this wasn't helpful. Fortunately, another room was available, so the situation was resolved. Overall, it was 9/10.
We booked this hotel for family who were visiting for graduation and we were very happy with the hotel. The staff was quick and efficient. The parking was nice. Everything was very clean.

This was a great spot to stay in Waikiki. Very close to everything. Food, small ABC food markets, beach etc. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Everything you would need for your stay. The kettle was hopeless but it had a good microwave, so that worked for our needs. Priced well for the area. Can't go wrong.

This hotel is centrally located and a close walk to the beach and shops. The rooms are clean and the beds were comfortable. Service is good and the view was okay from our 17th floor room. Ask for the 17th floor. Parking is 20 dollars a day but bikes are cheap to rent.
This property was very handy to the Ala Moans shopping centre with lots of eateries nearby. The beach is only about 10 min walk and there is a nice lagoon or open sea.

I've stayed at lots of hotels in HNL and as soon as I checked in and checked out the place I felt the need to write this review. Got into my room early. Greeted by the housekeepers warmly in the elevator. The room was perfect. Cheery and clean. Microwave, fridge, coffee maker, safe, iron and ironing board. Lots of lamps and they all worked. Nice gym and cute pool. Great location and great price and no stupid add-on rip-off resort/hospitality fee. I flatly refuse to stay at any hotel that charges a resort fee. Add the fact that it's part of the award winning Wyndham Points Program and I just found my go-to hotel in HNL. Thanks Ramada!!! I come to HNL a lot for business and I won't stay anywhere else now.

I was only at the Ramada for 1 night as I used the hotel as a place to adjust to the 6 hour time difference and as a hotel to explore Honolulu, before staying at the Aulani for 6 days .... the hotel was clean and 1960's chic , the view out of my window was beautiful, the parking was cheap, the pool was nice and the staff was friendly
Nice place wish the walls weren't so thin it sounded like someone was packing cigarettes all night.

We stayed one night in this hotel and the hotel is really nice. The staff is friendely and we can easily walk from Ala Moana Shopping Center or Waikiki from there. There is a lot of bar and restaurant around.
Very nice place, it was good quality for the price, and the staff were very friendly. Fairly easy walk to Ala Moana or to Waikiki. I will stay again on my next visit.

This hotel did not blow my mind but it also did not disappoint. What I got was a fair size room with all you could need, free internet and local calls, fridge, microwave, coffee machine, iron and ironing board, laundry facilites. I have stayed in swankier hotels where you have to pay for the internet. Coffee is provided in the lobby and the pool is a decent size so I was able to do a few lengths to beat my jet lag but it did not really get the sun. Location wise it is close to but not on the beach but it is only a short walk. You can also walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre and the centre of Waikiki very easily. As I was not driving the reception staff provided me with information on the city buses and I was able to catch various buses to Pearl Harbour, Diamond Head and Hanauma Bay. Loads of restaurants and bars nearby and the ABC store is just across the road. I really enjoyed my stay but as others have stated it does need sprucing up. I noticed it was used a lot by airline staff and if you are more of an independent traveller and you don't fancy resort style hotels then this is a good choice.

My visit to Honolulu was broken in two, and I stayed in the Ramada Plaza for 3 nights on the second leg; the first was a week in a more upscale, centrally located hotel, but I far preferred the Ramada. It is set back from a busy street, with almost no frontage on teh main road across from the monster Hilton Village, but the location makes the Ramada both quieter and smaller than the average Waikiki hotel while being well situated for access to the beach, the bus, and restaurants. The front desk is across from the entrance, so the staff are right there to greet you and maintain security. The hotel is small enough that the staff recognize you. There's free coffee in the morning--until 1 p.m., unlike my previous hotel, which took away the coffee at 10 a.m. The lobby has marble floors and classic rattan and bamboo furniture. Rooms are not stylish, but they are comfortably and well furnished: the brass lamps have pineapple details that are repeated in the green-and-gold (pineapple-colored) bedding, upholstered armchairs, and drapes. We had a balcony overlooking the pool and street, but set back from both for privacy and quiet, and enjoyed eating breakfast out there (room had fridge, microwave, and coffee-maker). The room had lots of small comforts: no desk (chose not to exchange the balcony for a desk), but the table was adequate for work (sigh--not a vacation); good free wifi. Good bed, pillows, and sheets. Two comfortable stuffed armchairs. Quiet toilet for middle-of-the-night use. Even a retractable clothesline over the tub. (And a tub, not just a shower.) Ample big towels. Exquisitely clean bathroom: the prefab shower is not fancy, but the walls had perfectly white silicone sealant, and a tub soak was not marred by the sight of dirt in any corners. Highly recommended!

We spent 5 nights here and enjoyed the location. Bus transportation right out front. Many restaurants and beach in walking distance. House keeping staff very helpful with needed supplies. Pool area very nice and laundry facilities available.

The people at the front were very nice and so helpful. Rooms were nice and clean and the cleaning personal were so funny and very nice. Had a most wonderful experience and the location was the best. All tours meet at flag pole just a short walk and because of that always stay at the Ramada Plaza. Be sure take swim suite and snorkel gear very close to beach.

First, I should tell you my bias. I think Waikiki is a sub-par Hawaiian vacation experience. Frankly, I think it's nuts to fly thousands of miles to a "tropical paradise" and spend your vacation in the concrete jungle that is Waikiki. Not that the place is completely without it's charms. But as far as I'm concerned, if you're spending more than 2 days of your Hawaii vacation in Waikiki, you're wasting your money.With that bias in mind, the Ramada is a reasonable place to stay in Waikikl for the price. I'd classify it as a 2 1/2 star hotel. Location is good, a little more than a 5-minute walk to one of the best Waikiki beaches. Staff is friendly and helpful. There are even some streets nearby you can park your car on for free (requires some effort to find a space though) if you want to save the hotel's $20 parking fee. For an older hotel, the elevators are zippy. Rooms are small; I don't recommend a family of four stay here for more than a night. And while the rooms are reasonably clean, some refurbishment is sorely needed. Like we had 2 arm chairs in our room that wouldn't cut it in a fleabag motel (fabric worn down). It's weird that management would think it was OK to leave them in a guest room. There were also some gaps in the bottom of the window panes that let Waikiki's considerable noise into our room (particularly bad if it's early morning garbage truck day).Bottom line, there are a lot of mediocre but acceptable places you can stay in Waikiki. Pick the Ramada if the value is better than the alternatives (if you have Wyndham Rewards points, consider their cash and points rates). Expect an OK place to crash. Do not expect a fancy hotel stay. Unless you're strictly a "city person," limit your stay to a couple of nights and get out and explore the rest of Hawaii.

What a great location! Minutes away from many restaurants, transportation, shopping and the "ABC" store!! Nice facility, clean and comfortable rooms, exceptional staff who were friendly and helpful. Great price for the room. When I return this will be where I stay.
This is an older hotel a few minutes walk from the beach and many restaurants.The staff we very helpful and welcoming.

Great, convenient location and a close walk to the beach, restaurants, shopping, etc. Greeted with a smiling at the check in desk and checked in quickly. Nice room for the four us in my family. We took an island hopper from Maui so, only one night but, the hotel is great and room was very clean with plenty of space since we only brought a single checked bag. We stayed previously at Wyndham Royal Garden a few blocks away which was a true gem off the beaten path. We've since heard it's hard to get into but had enough Wyndham points, we stayed this night free. Can't beat the price :)
The hotel was clean but in need of an overall up date. The front desk got our reservation wrong, but the adjustment was made easily.

The hotel is in a great location. It's in walking distance of several restaurants and the beach. However, the hotel rooms are passed due for renovation. I got a group rate since about 30 of us stayed the night before we left for a cruise. It was worth the group rate, nothing more.
user_name:
Adrienne C
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff and specifically Wendy Baros were fantastic. They met all of our needs and we were very pleased with the location of the property. We had a group of 25 people and everyone enjoyed their stay.

Stayed at the Ramada Plaza for eight nights. We had a large room with two double beds and ensuite. There are limited facilities and the fitness centre was closed though we were not told about this at the time of booking or was it advertised on the hotels website. The aircon was a little old and noisy. Besides all this, the hotel provided what we required during our visit, comfortable room. It's a 10 min walk to the centre of Waikiki and across the road from the Hilton Village and within a couple of streets to a major shopping centre.

The staff was really nice. But I tried to early check in and they said that I couldn't. I was so upset about that be because I was tired from treatment and just wanted to lay down and rest and I wasn't able to

This is all around nice hotel with good location near everything. We had a car and there is parking available with a cost of $25. Join the club and they take $5 off. Room is nice and big and so is the bed. Nothing to complain there. There is a good breakfast place around the corner since they have none. Good service and even one of the computer worked . Good price / quality ratio here.

Location was excellent. Bed was comfortable. Air conditioning worked. Nice TV. Hotel is older and a little "worn", but satisfactory. Pool looked very nice. 2 blocks from the beach. On several bus lines. Plenty of restaurants in all price ranges in the neighborhood.
This was a very nice hotel in the downtown area within easy walking of great restaurants and shopping centers and the beach

The hotel was clean and the rooms very spacious. Great location. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Specially Danny and Michael at the front desk. We were very pleasantly surprized by the quality of everything considering that the price was so reasonable. A short walk to the beach. Air-conditionally was a bit noisy, other than that everything else was perfect. I would definitely stay here again.

So we stayed here for two days before we got our rooms for Disney aulani.The location of the hotel is really great as it's close to the ala Moana shopping centre. The room was beautiful as all ramada hotels. Nice views of the outside and mountains nearby. Staff were on point really hospitable and kind. We were give macadamia nut chocolate box with sparkling water bottle as a gift for our honeymoon.Would recommend this as transport links to waikiki was straight forward too.

Enjoyed my recent stay! Tucked away between a few larger hotels, the Ramada Plaza Waikiki offers a quiet alternative with very reasonable rates! Staff all courteous and professional! Eateries, fast foods and high-end, all within walking distance! And only a couple of blocks from the Ala Moana Shopping Center!

I often stay away from the huge hotels, you get lost in them, parking is usually far from your room especially if you forget something in the car. Ramada has easy in & out parking $25/night which is reasonable compared to most at $30-$35, a short 5 min walk to nearby family beach with plenty of shades/trees and you don't feel packed like a sardine in other Waikiki beaches.Great staff, they all greet you going into elevator,walking in the hallways etc. Complimentary morning coffee/tea in the lobby.The rooms are clean with microwave/small fridge. Bed is super comfy! Computer/Printer for your use to print airline tickets, Free WIFI, Pool,Laundry Room and they held our luggage before and after check in from the airport. Did I mention quick in and out of your hotel vs. the biggest hotel chain? I highly recommend Ramada Plaza. I requested 2 rooms close to each other for our families and they obliged. Booked my rooms on Priceline.com, but careful as they don't have cancellation refunds thru that site, read fine prints. IHop, McDonalds, Buffalo Wings, ABC Stores, Liquor stores all walking distance. Forget staying in the pricey tourist traps near International Market Place and shops on Kalakaua Blvd. Spend your money on excursions instead. Aloha!

This hotel is very clean. Great location. It is only 10 min from Ala Moana outlet and from the beach. The buffet restaurant is just in the same building and provides 20% off for the Ramada's visitors. Coffee and tea was served in the lobby daily until 1 pm. The laundry room is in the hotel. My room was on the 15th floor facing to the city amazing view. I really enjoyed my stay. Would recommend for sure.
We found staff very helpful, laundry facilities were great. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, bed very comfortable. Will stay here again.

This property has improved 100% since our last stay three years ago. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff was helpful and accommodating. It suited our needs for a one night stay in Honolulu perfectly.

The value for the location and level of cost was excellent. If you are single or a couple with no kids it's perfect. You can walk to the big resorts on the boardwalk one block away and spend the money you saved on the room in the food, beverage and beach activities.

Ramada Plaza, Waikiki, 1830 Ala Moana Boulevard | Honolulu, Hawaii 96815 I like this place. It is not a high end place and yet it has many of the amenities that one might reasonably expect in a more expensive hotel. Coffee is available in the morning and is very good. Large lobby. Location is really good. Several relatively inexpensive restaurants on the block and more in the immediate area. Urgent care facility on the same block. My friends paid around $130 a night so it is a really good value. We noted large groups coming in to stay which suggests contracts with companies that believe that a good value is delivered for a good price. I agree. I would stay here again. Parking is available for $25 per day with a $5 discount if one is a member of the Wyndham Loyalty program.Room – 914Internet – free, very good wi-fi, does not require user name or password.Television – Panasonic, guessing maybe 36 inch. Placed on top of a six drawer dresser.DVD player – noAir conditioning – yes. The good thing is that the location does not direct the air flow directly towards the bed. Control is on the air conditioner.Electrical outlets – sufficient.Robes – no. Coffee Maker – yes, drip style. Poor location in the bathroom. Would have to move it to use it.Mini-fridge – yesMicrowave - yesSmoking – NoAlarm clock – yesSafe for valuables – yes but poorly located on a shelf close to the floor. Hard for an older person to get down there.Hair dryer – yesIroning board and iron – yesNote: There is a guest laundry on the second floor.Closet – very small closet with door. Insufficient number of hangars.Lighting – sufficientBathroom – typical bathroom with shower/bath tub.Towels, linens – excellentTissues (kleenex or equal) - YesFacecloths - yesBathroom amenities – Matrix Total Results shampoo, lotion and conditioner. Bar soap and a small bottle of mouth wash from Marietta Corporation. Amenity kit – noWeight scale – noUmbrella - noBed areaBed – King size, very comfortable, 4 firm good size Wynrest pillows. We requested a couple extra for a total of six.Bedside nightstands – good size with a single drawer and an open space below the drawer.I really like lamps that have an outlet.There is a large desk with two bulb lamp and, yes, an outlet. A mirror as well. Nice functional arragement.Pool / Exercise room – There is an outdoor pool but no hot tub. Appears clean and well kept. The exercise room is of reasonable size with towels stocked along one wall.. Has about six pieces of exercise equipment. I use the recumbent bike. As we were checking out, I saw a notice that the exercise room is closed as they move it to a different location.Breakfast – NoStaff are friendly and solicitous.

WE arrived at 10:30 at night for one night while waitiing for our two bedroom timeshare. The room the bed, and the shower were big, clean and comfortable and at an incredible price. The staff was courteous and helpful at every opportunity.

When traveling, it's quite depressing to ask the front desk for help but be poorly treated. Here was my story. I had stayed at this hotel from this February 1st to 15th. We are a family of 4 from Taiwan on vacation. One night, my daughter woke up from toothache, which was killing her. All I could do was comfort her. I didn't care to give her painkiller without the doctor's prescription. It's instinct that I turned to the front desk for help only to get an indifferent response. He said I had no idea about local dentist. I had no choice but to consult a pharmacist the next morning. At that time, I had an impulse to fly back home, cutting short of my unexpectedly terrible encounter. If I have a chance to visit Hawaii in the future, I won't take this hotel into account.
It is always a pleasant and enjoyable stay. The rooms are clean, good choice of stations on the television, good complimentary water and candy, good friendly staff. This is a diamond in the rough.

The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean and it is easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shops. The laundry room was an added benefit. The parking fee was a hidden expense, $25 P/day or $20 if you are a rewards member.

We stayed for 1 night (was supposed to be 2, but got bumped off our flight in LA so had to spend a night at LAX hotel) in March 2017. The hotel is nothing fancy, but perfect location--walking distance to Waikiki, easy access to restaurants, shopping, airport, and most tourist attractions. Good value, considering how expensive most Waikiki hotels are.

Enjoyed staying here. Staff were very friendly. Facilities in the room were clean and well maintained. Great restaurants very close by walking which is great after a long flight. Parking was easy. Access to the hotel was easy. We stayed down the road at the end of our trip and didn't appreciate how much value for money we got staying here vs. at other hotels similarly priced. I'd recommend this as an affordable option with the basics done very well. Recommend.

Great hotel! All staff was friendly and accommodating. Very easy self parking lot. Price was very reasonable. Rooms were clean and fresh and spacious. Easy to drive in and drive out. Convenient to everything! DO NOT HOWEVER, DINE AT GOOFY'S ACROSS THE STREET. PREJUDICE TO ALL EXCEPT THE JAPANESE. Also, the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. Quiet area too. And safe.

Good location, good personel but the furniture, carpet are too old and deteriorated. The door between my room and next room allowed to hear what was going on on the other side. Suggestion: offer milk with the morning coffee.
Location is important but we were traveling for the purpose of business meeting, it was convenient. And parking space is plenty.

Service attentive, pool clean. Room clean, nice to have refrigerator and microwave. Short walk to beach, just have to avoid the Hilton high priced stores enroute. Excellent for price on Weikiki beach. Could use facelift when compared to its neighbors but then it would cost more. Very satisfied with visit.

We arrived in HNL pretty early and were planned for an all day tour and Ramada Plaza Waikiki was very gracious and helpful in allowing us to store our luggage on site before check in. The room was clean and comfortable, staff was friendly. We really have no complaints.

Picked this property because of location. Not far from the airport and Cruise Terminal. Was only here for overnight. Staff very friendly. Furtiture a bit worn. But clean and comfortable. Walking distance to Ala Moana shopping centre. Pool was average but not far to the beach.

it was awesome. except the distance from waikiki beach, everything was awesome! staffs were vvery kind, and facilities were also clean and well organized. When i checked out, I asked to hold my bags until night because my flight was late night. They kept my back safely with document, i felt relieved. Also, there are many buses right in front of the hotel, so i could use buses easily. 와이키키 해변에서 먼(걸어서 17분정도) 것만 빼면 모든게 완벽한 곳이였습니당. 수영장도 깨끗하고 세탁실도 잇는데 저렴했고, 방도 넓고 깔끔했습니다. 하와이 호텔들 오래되서 제값 못한단 말을 많이 들었는데 이 호텔은 10만원 초반대로 딱히 주변보다 비싸지도 않은데 깔끔하고 좋았습니다. 강추합니다! 그리고 호텔앞에 버스정류장이 바로 있어서 공항이든 어디든 가기가 편합니당! ㅎㅎ 강추❤️

We stayed here because we were attending a conference at the convention center, which makes this hotel well situated because it's only a 5/10 minute walk there. However, this hotel is really not worth the high rate. It's pretty dated, looks a bit run down and the rooms are on the small side. Does not have any food service within the hotel, though they do provide free tea and coffee in the mornings. We also had to pay $25 a night for parking, which for the price of this hotel seems outrageous (thankfully only did this one night). Staff were mostly really helpful, but we had a few interactions with some rude staff too. The only thing it has going for it is its central location and proximity to the beach, which is probably what allows this place to charge such a high rate. If I were traveling for pleasure to Honolulu, I would not stay here.

Everything went smooth until we got to room. Went to unpack and found cockroaches in dresser drawers. Called front desk and they immediately sent a couple people from housekeeping up and they caught and removed the offended critters. No other problems were encountered but the whole experience did make us feel more than a little uncomfortable.

I really loved the location of this hotel, not overpriced, staff was fun and very helpful. The facility is a little dated but it was very clean. Conveniently located with restaurants and shopping within steps of the front door.

Stayed here for 6 nights on my second trip to Oahu. Good location rooms super clean and no resort fee to pay either so made it really good value for money. We went to the Big Island first and stayed at the Mariott Waikoloa and it was double the price of the Ramada and I have to say the rooms at the Ramada were just as good as the Mariott! Loved the room service option not part of the hotel but they will deliver from loads of different restaurants in Waikiki which is a fantastic idea and great after a long day of sightseeing. Lots of shops in the area and I hop 2 minutes walk away for breakfast. Little souvenir shop.in lobby with a really friendly lady running it When we come back to Oahu we will definitely stay here again. If you want 5 star luxury then this is not that but offers everything you need for a decent and very comfortable stay at a decent price. I am a travel agent in the UK and will be recommending this property to my clients. Thank you Ramada Plaza .

This hotel is a bit run-down and could use some updating in the rooms and hallways, though the main lobby is quite nice. The front desk staff and the cleaning staff were excellent. The hotel is in close proximity to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and beach. I would recommend this hotel for people attending conferences as it is one of the closer hotels to the convention centre.
Nice hotel. Room were super super small! I hate paying for parking at my own hotel that I just paid an arm and a leg for! Close to lots of locations.

very small room, and smell like pee, very disappointed of our room ,also i love coffee in the morning but the coffee maker was set up right next to the toilet bowl, 1st time i`ve seen coffee put in the toilet, i guess we just got the bad room.

Definitely a dated hotel, room was nice as I only needed it to sleep in. Patio door left a little to the imagination. All you can eat Chinese buffet restaurant right out front was by far the worst Chinese I have ever had, Breakfast buffet was just OK, nothing to right home about. I would stay again for the value but would definitely eat somewhere else.
The location is faabulous, price was great, rooms were clean, comfortable, and the service was excellent. Everyone was very friendly and helpful! I would definately stay there again...

Parking attendant sits outside, not affiliated to ramada, wanted $7 just for us to take our luggage up to the room. we were not going to stay , just get the key to the room, put luggage in and leave. She was miserable yelled at us Told us 10 minuets was all that was allowed. Yelled again.BAD FOR BUSINESS!

Our first time to Oahu and we loved staying at the Ramada. Very friendly, close to everything, and no resort fee #bonus! The room was slightly musty but my Purification Oil from Young Living helped make that better. We will be back!
The hotel was a few blocks from the beach and on a fairly busy street. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, good value for a family trip.

No complaints with the hotel, room or service. Clean and comfortable accommodations. Friendly staff. Request a city view with a lanai on upper floor. Neighbourhood can be a bit noisy. Lots of amenities close by.

2 Night stay from 17 February to 19 February. I have stay here before, Nice Hotel, Clean and not too expensive, unlike other properties in the area. Good size room, with a comfortable King size bed. Not sure why, but the pillows here are some of the most comfortable of all the hotels in Honolulu. Not sure of the brand or where they get them but they are great.
Always a friendly welcome at this Ramada. Clean room, nice location and good staff make this a great stay.

The room is clean and has a small fridge, microwave oven and safe. The beds are comfortable but small for a family of 4 (doubles). Most of the rooms don't have balconies.The air conditioning worked well and wasn't too loud. The hotel is located near the Hilton Hawaiian Village side of Waikiki. I personally prefer the other side of Waikiki more. The beach and Ala Moana are within a ten-minute walk from the hotel. You can get groceries from the six nearby ABC stores or the Food Pantry behind the hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. Coffee and ice water provided daily until 1 pm is definitely a plus. Goofy's cafe across the street has good healthy food. I stayed on the 16th floor so the road traffic noise wasn't an issue. The hotel is small so there is no long waits for the elevators, or long walks down hallways, which is a plus. The pool area was nice and peaceful as there wasn't many guest using it. The laundry room is is next to the pool, so you can do your laundry and relax by the pool at the same time. Fitness room was big and well equipped. (also by the pool). We had no issues with parking and always found a spot in the easy to navigate large lot. This is an older hotel so don't expect luxury.

The room is clean and equipped with fridge and microwave oven. The beds are comfortable and give you a good night's sleep. Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana are within a ten-minute walk from the hotel. You can get groceries from the six nearby ABC stores. The staff are friendly and helpful. And the surprisingly good coffee provided daily until 1 pm is definitely a plus.

If you want a basic place to stay while in Waikiki, this property will be acceptable. It is basically a clean room with a clean bed and bathroom. Since most of the time your stay is not spent in the hotel, especially in this location, the price can't be beat
Rooms are very nice and they have free coffee downstairs in the AM hours. Gym needs to be revamped.

The hotel is wonderful. It is small but provides a great guest experience. The hotel staff are amazing and friendly. By the second day they recognized our faces and were always willing to help us out whether it was directions or a great place to eat dinner.
Very basic hotel but suited our needs perfectly. Close to beach and shopping. Very nice, friendly staff
Nice hotel. Clean with friendly staff that's in a great location close to restaurants and shops. Free wifi was a plus.

First off, its on the 'wrong' side of the street. So no direct views of the beach (but I was on the other side - more on that later). Good moderately priced hotel. Basic but overall good value. Bed a little soft but better than rock hard. Rooms face either Ala Moana shopping center or the Hilton Haw'n Village/ Diamond Head. Only 1 row of rooms with balcony, if that matters to you. I had balcony facing Ala Moana - good and quiet. Minimal street noise but also, minimal views.  Parking is self park, $25 regular price but (a) unlimited in and out and (b) its on the ground level, no ramps to maneuver. 3 Different Airlines use for the hotel for their Flight crews so mornings are busy with them in/out but they don't have cars, so parking shouldn't be a problem. Located at one end of Waikiki, so depending on what you're looking for, keep that in mind. Easy access to bus transportation and the shopping center is a 10 min walk or so away. Restaurant options within walking distance are a little limited. Friday night fireworks show across the street at the Haw'n Village is an easy 5 min walk away, so be sure to try and catch it !

飯店的位置極佳，離海灘、購物中心和餐廳都很近。房間整理的很乾淨，備品齊全。前台的服務人員也很親切。下一次再有機會到檀香山玩的話還會選擇這間飯店！The beach, shopping area and a variety of restaurants are within walking distance. The room is clean which is important for us with young kids. The front desk is friendly and informative. We are satisfied with our stay in the Ramada Plaza Waikiki and will definitely choose it again when we visit Hawaii the next time!

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It takes about 10 minutes to walk to the beach, about 20 minutes to get down Kalakaua (the main drag of Waikiki), and another 20 in the opposite direction to the Ala Moana Center (big shopping center with uber high-end stores). It felt a bit like a Quality Inn with the paper cups in the bathroom but it had what you needed for not spending much time in your room. Nothing really wrong with it, but nothing special either. The staff was overall friendly, and helped me get a shuttle back to the airport at the end of the trip.
user_name:
Sarah B
Palo Alto, California, United States

review_body: We booked this hotel in Waikiki because we were only in Honolulu to take a day tour. This is a no frills hotel best for those on a budget. Our room was very clean and they have all the amenities you could want in the bathroom. The wifi here is free and very strong. There is a pool that gets good sunlight for laying out. The hotel is in a great location and you are a short ten minute walk to the beach by going across the street and walking through the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Front desk staff was very friendly. This is a great choice if you're looking for a budget friendly hotel, close to the beach.

If you want to be central in Waikiki without paying resort prices, this is a great option. Everything was fine, but not over the top. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but it was a great place to settle in and sleep. Parking cost extra and was in an open-air parking lot with very small spaces.

After a long flight I booked this hotel because it was listed as having an airport shuttle. It did not and the Speedieshuttle was an hour wait. We paid for a taxi to the hotel. Not a great deal, rooms were clean but dated. Bed was comfortable. For the price we paid, you can (and we did) find better, nicer accomodations closer to the beach for less money.

We stayed at the ramada waikiki over the 2016-17 New Years Day weekend - family of four; 2 older teenagers. It is a great modest hotel, and very conenient to 'the action' on the main shopping street and beach of waikiki. I travel a lot on business staying in mid-tier hotels, and the staff h and facility here are good. One big negative - they are heavily promoting a full meal buffet restaurant that i attached to the hotel. this restaurant boasts being 'under new management'. But the food is sub-par quality. Even our teenaged boys were turned off. rmada is going to after help this restaurant pull up its socks, or stop promoting it to theirpatrons.

This hotel is across the road from the big Hilton Waikiki Village hotel - it's cheaper so if you have a conference etc. at the Hilton, stay at the Ramada to save money.Bath tub was appreciated but the water level goes down while you sit in it.They won't change your sheets unless you tell them - should be the other way around - sheets will be changed unless you tell them not to.I had to ask for a kettle to boil water. No tea bags - I asked why and I got the response that in America most people do not drink tea which I said was ridiculous and more ridiculous for a hotel serving guests from all over the world.Check in is too late - 3pm. The day is nearly over. Check out is good at 12pm.Blinds don't close in the room - only the think white curtains close - not sure if people can still see into the room through the white curtains.I was impressed with the small bottles of mouth wash provided.Soap etc. not refilled in the bathroom - I had to spend time asking for the refill. I asked to be contacted by a manager about this but no one contacted me - managers seem to be not interested in guests and their concerns.There needs to be a TV channel guide near the TV - really hard to work out the TV channels. No Skynews Australia channel.The Bible in the room was appreciated.Free internet and printing available in the lobby through desktop computers.I was not happy that when I asked for my luggage to be stored on my check out day- it was just placed in the lobby rather than locked in the store room - this is a security issue and they seem to be lazy by not putting the luggage in the luggage room which they have - anyone could discreetly walk away with the luggage or take things out or put things in.Staff are overall cold and self focused - they don't seem to be passionate about serving guests and making sure they have the best hotel experience. They are not acting as if they own the hotel and not trying to perform at their best for their boss.I asked for a bus to the airport on my check out day and this was booked and arrived on time. Cheaper than a taxi.I booked for extra nights but was not given my original cheaper room rate - it seems to me that repeat customers and good customer relations could be produced by not charging more for extra nights - I booked online but they could show some initiative and offer a refund on the extra money paid as room rates seem to change daily.
We stayed there for 2 nights! Hotel in no frills experience! Value to the money in the Waikiki area! Waikiki is not in walking distance with kids!

Good value for money in this medium rated hotel. Excellent location in Waikiki. Well appointed rooms although fairly small in size. Missed a lanai and pool area was quite dull in an area mostly shaded by surrounding buildings. Well-working internet connection. Recommended if you need to keep down accommodation expenses.

Stayed at the Ramada Plaza on NYE. Comfortable room, very good service from housekeeping and cleanest, brightest laundry facilities I've ever seen in a hotel! Reception staff were very polite and helpful. The coffee maker in the room wasn't working and a call to housekeeping was responded to promptly. 15-20 minute walk from Ramada to Macy's part of Waikiki. Or $10 cab ride.
Personnel wee very courteous. Rooms clean and comfortable. Close to Hilton shopping center with lots of food choices and shopping

First of all, without realizing the time, I arrived 1 hour prior to check in. The front desk clerk mentioned the time, but did not hesitate checking me in, which was very much appreciated since I had been in travel mode for the last 10 hours. It is a quiet property which fronts a main street though Honolulu. The back, however, is up against a small one-way street. You can't see or hear the ocean from the property, but the walk to the beach was only 5-10 minutes. There are numerous places to eat along both sides of the street. Some are offer local fares, and some are from national chains. The property is used by several major airlines as a lay-over hotel, but this did not affect my stay in the least. The room was quiet and clean, and the bed was comfortable. My only complaint, and it is minor, is the parking was very tight. Although, I never found the lot full and I was there during the weekend prior to the 75th anniversary of Pearl Harbor. I very much would stay at this property again.

The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. My only complaint is the airport shuttle service they called for us. I use a power scooter to get around and when the reservation was made I was given a price of $28 for two of us. When the shuttle arrived he was going to charge an additional $16 for the wheelchair. I refused and the bellman called for a taxi that came out costing only $3 more than the quoted price.

I spent 6 nights at the Ramada Waikiki, and overall thought it was quite convenient. The hotel is just across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, with its associated shops/restaurants. It's a 8-10min walk to the very large Ala Moana Center (check out Poi Bowl in its food court for tasty Hawaiian food at a steal). Waikiki Beach is 20-25min walk away. The room is large, clean, and comfortable; it comes with work desk, dresser, TV, armchair and ottoman, closet area, microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. The king sized bed was nice. The bathroom is a bit too plain and white, but fine enough. I found the coin operated laundry really convenient, and it was one of the reasons I chose this property. The pool is on the second floor, and has a bunch of chaises and separate dining area; towels are provided; pool was a bit cold in November though when I visited. I loved that the hotel is just across the street from the entrance to Kahanamoku Beach, which is beautiful, and imo, more peaceful than Waikiki Beach. They gave me late check-out, but it was only 1hr later (1pm instead of 12pm) -- there is an option to extend your stay to 5pm if the room is available for an additional $75. Delicious Kona coffee was available every morning in the lobby. This Ramada seems more amenity heavy compared to other Wyndham properties, likely because of its location in Hawaii. At about $110/night, I found it a good value, and would recommend it.
user_name:
fielight
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms were very average...no ocean view and was disappointed that we had to pay an additional $30 for a roll away bed.

I stayed here for four nights in November. I stay at a lot of Wyndham properties, and this one is a winner.The check-in was quick and the staff was very friendly throughout my stay. My room request was granted and I enjoyed the welcoming gift for Diamond members of Wyndham Rewards. The room faced the rear of the property and was well appointed and exceptionally clean, with great views of the neighborhood. The pool area was nice and I was surprised how despite the hotels location, received a lot of sun each day.I had breakfast around the corner at McD's each day (I love their Hawaiian Big Breakfast with rice, eggs, Spam, and local sausage) and then walked the length of the canal to the zoo, had coffee on the beach at The New Otani, and then walked back across Waikiki by a different route each day.I then sat out by the pool until late afternoon to get some sun, then walked over to Ala Moana Park for the sunset views, and then to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and Ilikai in the evenings for entertainment. The Ala Moana Mall and the Ward Center are both an easy walk and have great shopping and fantastic food court options. The fort is down and across the street and makes for a nice stroll.I liked the morning coffee service in the lobby and there were a lot of airline crews staying here, so you know it is a safe place. They also have a discount price available deal with the all-you-can-eat place next to the lobby.In other words, this is a great place to stay, surrounded by more expensive places.For meals, I recommend the pink chiffon pancakes at Cinnamon's at the Illikai, and everything at the Wailana Coffee House - both nearby.I can't wait to build up some more Wyndham Reward points and come back for a full week.

Stayed here for 2 days while in transit from Australia to Canada. Hotel is close to everything including many restaurants and the mall. The west end of Waikiki is a 5 minute walk away. Wifi is terrible in the lobby but works fine in the rooms. Pool was a nice area just to relax in. Rooms had a microwave as well as a fridge which was great to store snacks.I'd definitely stay here again as it's almost cheaper than using Airbnb.

I stayed for 6 nights - and it was absolutely wonderful. The rooms were nice, had all of the amenities I needed (mini fridge and microwave were great to have), and the staff was so friendly and helpful. It was also a great, central location in Waikiki. Laundry on site and free wifi were a huge plus too! I have only positive things to say and wanted to thank all of the staff for making this a memorable visit.
Thanks for a great hotel experience. One suggestion: find some space for a continental breakfast room.
A quiet and centrally located vacation spot. Not elegant but a nice stay for a great price. I would book it again.

We booked on line months before our visit to Hawaii in November 2016. On arrival checkin was fast and the room, king bed for 2 adults, was impeccable. Clean, roomy, lots of room to store luggage and stuff. Wifi worked well and reasonably fast. Bed was very comfortable, with an excess of pillows. Wide screen digital TV with lots of channels. Bathroom was clean and had a handy clothes line for swim suits etc. Parking was outside in a reserved lot, $20/night. No in-hotel restaurant but the IHOP nearby was excellent, and there were other large restaurants within walking distance. Staff was friendly and very helpful. All in all, we were very comfortable for the six nights we were there. We will be staying there again on the return leg. Mahalo, Ramada Plaza Waikiki!
hotel was okay for the price , probably the least expensice in the area. Definitely not close to the beach , waikiki is a 10 min walk

I really enjoyed this hotel and the pool was nice to have even though were minutes from the ocean and world famous Waikiki beach. I wish there was more parking available even though it cost 20$ a night which isn't bad, you could take your chances and park on the street also but sometimes it's filled up because it's free. I liked the neat lil gift shop in the hotel. Even grabbed some stuff from there. Staff was always very friendly and he housekeeping did a great job.  I would definitely come back to this hotel. Thanks for having us!

Enjoyed our stay here. the staff were friendly - probably could still do with more knowledge on how to get to various attractions but they were helpful. It's a central location between Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana Shopping Centre - an easy walk to each. The Trolley Bus and The Bus stop just out the front. (Just beware on the way back that there's a bit of a walk because there's no close crossing over Ala Moana Blvd to the Hotel.) There are a number of restaurants close by including a 24hr one and there are two close ABC shops!The rooms are clean and whilst not huge the bed is and it's comfortable to boot!There is a laundry with washers and dryers.The pool and gym are ok - although our one complaint with the is that the pool closes at 9pm (which is fine) but we were sitting out by the pool waiting for clothes to dry - it was a hot night and we didn't want to sit in the room with the dryers. The door of the laundry was opened out onto the pool area in any case. The security guy had been past a couple of times and spoken to us - I was reading and my husband drawing and we were clothed and fairly obviously not going to jump in the pool and on his third swing past he told us we had to go in. I pointed out that we weren't in the pool and were waiting for clothes to dry and it was really hot in the laundry but he was not interested - so we ended up in the hot laundry with the door to the pool area still open! So maybe there needs to be a bit more flexibility!Also, although the staff are great with looking after your luggage it might help to perhaps try and have some rooms for those of us who arrive at 7am after the long haul flight from Australia. Having to walk around until 3.00pm when you've not had any sleep and need a shower is not the greatest!We'd stay here again.
